description:
The coffee: I rarely get a latte because I think it's just too much milk, but I could not pass up the excellent latte art and interesting flavors I read about them having. Often, I'll go to places that post pictures of their elaborate art only for them to do very basic or boring designs when I actually order coffee. I was not disappointed here. Of the five different lattes we ordered, each had it's own unique flair, and each individual one was more interesting than any I had seen anywhere else. I got the Nutella latte and it tasted like if you mix an espresso shot into your hot chocolate. It was very good because I like hot chocolate but definitely not for the coffee purist. 

The shop: I liked the decor, but it was a bit dimly lit. It was a nice place to meet up with friends and take pictures of coffee, especially with the natural lighting and more blueish hues. If I'm in town again I would love to come back here.
author: Daniel N.

description:
Home wins for its SUPER CUTE concept lattes, EQUALLY ADORABLE decor and A+ throwback hiphop/easy listening music. 

I've had my eye on the Birthday Cake latte ever since I first laid eyes on it on Instagram years ago, and it lived up to my expectations! It is definitely a sweeter latte; the girl helping me offered to make it less sweet, which I think most people would appreciate.

I had actually come with the intention of doing work here, without realizing that they restrict laptop use at some front tables. I didn't mind this policy at first (in fact, I applaud them for it) until I realized that their large back room only had 1 table and a TON of unused space. They could definitely add in an extra few tables back there and it would still be more than roomy!

Home, thank you for being equally easy on the tastebuds as you are on the eyes!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Long story short, Home is no longer as sweet as it used it be.

Dropped in today to get some work done and enjoy a nice drink, but to my dismay, all I got was frothy milk with a tea bag inside that didn't give the drink any flavor. The pieces of lavender sprinkled on top were the only source of flavor in this jasmine lavender tea latte. It was so unpleasant that I had to take it back to the counter and they were nice enough to take the drink back and refund me. I didn't get another drink because I really didn't want to be disappointed yet again. 

There also aren't enough tables to fill the large back room, and people were awkwardly crowding the packed front room because there's not enough seating to sit down and wait for your order.

FYI the prices online don't reflect in-store prices, in case you're referencing their online menu like I was while making my way over.

I used to consider Home one of the best coffee shops in the city but this opinion has definitely changed. Not sure if it's worth the trek all the way over to the Richmond for sub-par drinks when SF has so many gems for your coffee shop needs.
author: Nikki R.

description: Nice interior decor but the barista failed at latte art (see pic). Also not a lot of seating available.
author: Elisa L.

description:
Home cafe is the quintessential millennial coffee shop. Cute and minimalist decor, hipster baristas, cute coffee drinks with even cuter names. Cute stuff all around.

I got the birthday cake latte, whose pictures have taken over their yelp page and Instagram feed. It's without a doubt one of the most colorful drinks I've ever seen in my life. The taste is where I'd assume most coffee  connoisseurs would have the most to criticize about this latte. The true quality of the coffee is definitely masked by the sugariness of the drink, but I like my lattes more on the sweet side so it didn't bother me much. It tastes pretty much like a regular vanilla latte, but seeing so many colors does add some fun to it.

Come early or I can assure you that there'll be no seats left. Good place to work or catch up with friends!
author: Priscilla S.

description:
Went here with a couple of friends on Saturday around 1pm. Cute place, with some tables and people doing work. They do have a couple tables that say no laptops allowed, and we were able to snag a spot.

I got the Birthday Cake Vanilla Latte (~$7 with plain soy milk for an extra 0.75) - except I didn't get the syrup because I just wanted the rainbow color and not the sweetness. It came out beautifully with perfect latte art. It tasted like any other latte though since I didn't get any of the added sugar. The addition of the rainbow sprinkles also was a cute touch. 

My friend got the Lavender Latte, which she enjoyed, but had to ask for more lavender because they barely gave her any (As seen in picture, before she got more). 

I would definitely come here again to try another unique latte/ their toasts that look super good.
author: April L.

description: Flew into OAK from ATL the other morning and was in SERIOUS need of caffeination. Looked on Yelp and found this cafe, and I'm so glad I did. It was DELICIOUS! I got the rose latte and honestly wished I could've tried the lavender as well. I don't like overly sweet coffee and this was just right! My aunt got the birthday cake latte and said it was super yummy!
author: Jami G.

description:
Very hip cafe located on a very established street! This is has quite a different atmosphere than it's neighbors on Clement. Serving picturesque drinks and bold, statement toasts - this is a millennial's dream.

White walls, marble tables, and clean atmosphere proves Home to be both a place of productivity as well as socializing. Clement street also has many other businesses making parking hard to come by, but there are a couple bus lines a block or two out. 

I got the Cookie Monster Latte and the Avo-Cuddle! I asked for the latte a little less sweet which was a mistake because then the cookie butter flavor didn't come through. It was absolutely adorably crafted, and their staff is very kind and friendly. The avocado toast was 100% yummers though! The bread was fluffy and the avocado was generous for the price.
author: Navila H.

description:
Love this place! Such a cozy, cute and stylish place to snack, work and hangout and in a great location. My boyfriend had the Cookie Monster latte and I had the matcha latte. They skillfully poured the milk into each to make them look like two swans facing each other. Both were delicious. We enjoyed the avocado toast sampler - 1 piece of toast cut into 3 with different toppings. Very yummy and a fun take on avocado toast. Also loved the black sesame muffin. 
There are usually lots of people working on laptops here, making it a welcoming place to work or study. The staff are very friendly. I highly recommend checking out this place.
author: Samantha E.

description:
It's your typical instagram-worthy, hipster cafe, but I love it. I had the Seoul Avo Toast, Lavender Jasmine Tea Latte, and a Thai Tea Custard (cannot get enough of these Third Culture Bakery pastries). The kimchi in the avocado toast went surprisingly well with the avocado, and the latte was perfectly lightly sweetened. I usually go for the Mochi Muffin, but had to try the Thai Tea Custard, and it was almost as good (they offered to warm it up too!).

There were people on their laptops at the back of the cafe and on the stools at the front window, but most of the people in the middle were having good time chatting so you'll probably want to bring your headphones if you're coming to study!
author: Alice C.

description:
Coffee is good. Service is decent. Spacious interior. I like this place a lot. Not giving 5 star coz it looks and feels a bit familiar. Just a bit too many similar rustic looking cafe around in SF. First world problem but nevertheless a problem nowadays...lol

They have a designated no computer area and I have seen them actually enforce the rule and ask ppl move. Thumbs up and keep on the good work!!
author: John C.

description:
I'm not sure what I was more excited about...finally trying the birthday cake latte, or realizing that they sold mochi muffins here! I wanted to order one of everything but decided on the cookie butter latte, since my boyfriend ordered the birthday cake latte. 

I was actually kinda disappointed by the cookie butter latte. The latte art and little cookie crisps were cute, but it was bitter and didn't taste anything like cookie butter, like I had hoped it would. However I did enjoy the birthday cake latte! It was beautifully designed, and super sweet and flavorful, as the cashier had explained. I also had a taste of the coconut vanilla latte, and even though I don't like coconut too much, it was super yummy! Definitely recommend the birthday cake for those with a sweet tooth, and the coconut vanilla for those who want a flavorful latte but not too sweet. 

From the pastry case, we ordered the mochi muffin and Thai tea custard cake, which are from Third Culture Bakery. It was so yummy!! I loved how subtle the sweetness was and how chewy it was from the mochi. We also had the milk & cereal toast. The condensed milk was the perfect amount. The strawberries were nice and ripe, and make you feel less bad for eating a bunch of sugary cereal haha! 

Would definitely come back to Home Cafe! They had really nice decor, and a solid menu. The cashier was super friendly also, I wish I got her name so I could give her proper credit!
author: Ashley C.

description:
TL;DR: Lovely space, friendly baristas, fun latte art, good coffee.

I'm not a latte girl, but this place is definitely an Instagrammer's heaven with their creative, colorful latte creations! I come here for cold brew and avocado toast! The Seoul Much Avo toast is such a fun twist to a millennial favorite. Who knew kimchi on avocado toast was a good combo?! Yum! They use generous slices of brioche so it's definitely shareable.

So happy to have this coffee shop in my neighborhood! I def recommend stopping in if you're in the area :)
author: Emily K.

description:
The "Welcome Home!" emblazoned across the wall reflects Home's homey atmosphere and food/drinks worthy of Instagram.

To be honest, the main draw for me was the Instagram worthy drinks that I saw posted not too long ago.  Specifically, I was drawn to the birthday latte which is beautifully decorated on top with a kaleidoscope of rainbow colors and sprinkles to match.  Like most things, you should not judge a book by its cover and this is definitely an example.  Even when ordering the barista delightfully warned that the drink was more like a hazel nut flavor.  In someways a let down, the drink was still solid and its beauty more than made up for its just okay flavor.

A hipster hangout would not be complete with a menu of avocado toast options.  Because I was craving something with a little Asian flair, I ordered the Seoul Much Avo which was their avocado toast with pieces of kimchi, pine nuts, and sesame seeds.  The kimchi was a welcome kick of spiciness to give the avocado on toast.  Though if I were to go back, I would probably have their flight which gives an offering of three of their avocado toasts.

While there are several tables with outlets for studying, the cafe does have several tables reserved for people who want to socialize and catch up.  Their aim to try to promote social interaction is a noble one and definitely fits with the atmosphere and vibe they promote.

The staff was pretty helpful and attentive.  Street parking, but much better to just walk or Uber over.

Overall, Home SF has decent tasting but beautiful looking creations worthy of a visit.
author: Patrick S.

description:
When I saw that home was going to open up close to where I live, I was ecstatic! I honestly really love this cafe in the sunset and for it to be a few blocks away from me, it's definitely a plus!

I love their lavender latte and the coconut vanilla latte as well! I reviewed both previously and they are still just as tasty! I went on grand opening with my sister we got the birthday cake latte and Cookie Monster latte. Both were beautiful but they were only lukewarm and not hot, which was weird? The taste for the birthday cake was a bit on the sweet side and it was a beautiful latte. Cookie Monster had hints of speculoos but it wasn't overly sweet which I like plus it's tasty with the cookies!

I know they have new toasts on the menu, I cannot wait to come back sometime after work and to enjoy one of their lattes with a toast! 

Total for 2: $10
author: Stella J.

description:
I am not one to hang out at Cafes or Coffee houses, but when one of my kids and their friend asked me to join them ( translated: pay for their drinks and lunch) I agreed.

Home is a surprisingly good cafe serving seriously good food and really cute and tasty Lattes.

I ordered a birthday latte ( which is so not me) and it was really beautiful to look at and to drink.

My avocado toast was on point: Beautifully ripe avocados, perfectly tender greens, and hearty bread.

Definitely a great place to hang out and grab a bite!
author: David G.

description: Come for the delicious & beautiful lattes. The place gets full and people stay a very long while with their laptops, etc. Almost kind of unfair to a customer that just wants to eat a little something and drink a latte. Oh well.
author: Emy B.

description:
Came here because I wanted to have coffee with creative flavors for a change. I saw they have different types of flavors that includes rose and lavender, I was sold already. I got the rose latte, and it was good! Coffee wasn't very strong (just how I like it) and the rose flavor was also just right. 

It's a great place to sit down and talk, many tables available, but probably won't accommodate large parties. The drinks were made pretty fast, and the barista even had my name written using foam from milk. How cute.
author: Elle T.

description:
Food: 4/5 I ordered a birthday latte. The flavor was there but it was just okay. The latte art was so just pretty =)

Service: Great Service! Employees had great service and the wait for my latte was not long at all. I came here on a Friday afternoon. 

Ambiance: Decor is great and is good for taking your ig photos. There are people who study in this place and it is pretty quiet in there.

Price: Tad pricey so not an every day kind of item. The latte art is amazing though!

Would I come here again? Yes bc latte art
author: Celina D.

description:
The lattes here are so pretty! The milk is frothed perfectly.  It's smooth and velvety.  Has a great mouth feel when you're sipping it.  I got the cookie monster latte, and it was awesome to eat cookies and sip a latte at the same time.  The cups are huge and delicious.  Worth it for $5ish per cup.  

When I arrived, there was a line out the door, and the wait took pretty long.  Difficult to find seating too.  Friendly staff, and clean inside.  Can't believe how popular this place was.
author: Edward N.

description:
Instagram-worthy food is all the rage in Los Angeles (and as is true about so many things there, it's more about style than substance), so I came into Home with low expectations as it's gotten a lot of buzz here in the Bay Area for its beautifully crafted coffee drinks. But, as is often the case in the Bay Area unlike its neighbor down south, I find that there is plenty of substance to match the style here.

In particular, they've got plenty of latte variations here, whether red velvet, Nutella, lavender, or a "cookie monster" (cookie butter) which comes with actual cookies in it. Better yet, some their bites are quite delicious, like a bacon cheddar scone. I usually opt for bacon cheddar anything, anywhere I go, as a safe bet, but here it was quite good. Above all, the service was incredibly friendly, proactively engaging, and explanatorily helpful. A solid venue in the outer Richmond!
author: Vincent L.

description:
While on my recent trip to SF, this place was recommended to my sister for their birthday cake latte so we decided to add this to our list of places to visit.

We came here on a Monday morning (Labor day) and it was PACKED. The line was out the door so I recommend having someone wait in line to order and then have someone else get a table. Parking is as usual, whichever metered spot is open. 

I ordered the Coke-tastic (2 shots of espresso + coke + scoop of vanilla ice cream) and my sister ordered the Birthday cake (rainbow vanilla latte). We decided to order some toast as well since it was brunch time. We ordered the Say Cheese and Let's Avo-Cuddle.

The cashier who took my order was to nice! I didn't get a chance to ask his name but he definitely gave me a warning about the coke-tastic. If you don't want a sugar crash AND a caffeine crash DO NOT ORDER THIS DRINK. I thought I was going to be okay but I definitely crashed later. The drink was a bit odd at first since it was coke AND espresso but the ice cream made the two work together very well. The birthday cake latte was super cute and a little bit on the sweet side but definitely picture worthy. The toast we ordered, on the other hand, was meh. The Say cheese for some reason tasted like gasoline. I wasn't sure how they melted the cheese but my sister and boyfriend tried the toast and they both agreed that there was a gasoline taste to it. The avo-cuddle (super cute pun) was not bad though, they definitely gave plenty of avocado. I definitely recommend giving this place a try if you're looking for cute places to dine at in SF.
author: Diana L.

description:
Home cafe feels and tastes like home to me. Employees are amazing, always take the time to see how my day is going, make sure the WiFi is working, make my drink extra instagrammable.

Personal favorites: Lavender Tea Latte and the Kimchi Avocado Toast
author: Sydney G.

description:
Got the birthday cake latte because it was my birthday! LOL It basically tasted like a vanilla latte. THE LATTE IS SO COLORFUL LMAO SO EXTRA it's great for instapics. Otherwise, it's too pricey to indulge in on a daily basis. 

The interior is very minimalistic, how I like my cafes, and there is ample seating and outlets. Wifi is free, so it's a good study/work spot. 

I like how they have a rule that the first few tables are no laptops, which promotes a more social atmosphere. Good spot to chill with friends!
author: Tiffany H.

description:
My family went to the nearby Dragon Beaux for Father's Day for lunch. The wait was extremely long so we wandered into this cafe to grab some drinks as we waited. The interior of the cafe is photogenic, San Francisco, clean, etc. We ordered the Birthday Cake Latte, and an original hot chocolate with almond milk.

The Birthday Cake Latte (aka Rainbow Latte) looks just like all the pictures here. Colorful, insta-worthy, and very extra. It's a very sweet latte, as the name Birthday Cake would suggest. I think the drink was enjoyable, but it's more about the aesthetic than the flavor. The hot chocolate was a little disappointing. The flavor was kind of weak and it was a little watery. Would have preferred more chocolate flavor in a hot chocolate.
author: Marie S.

description:
He walks into a room, and he can't stop looking at her cause she's just so beautiful. What would probably ruin this moment would be if he said some kind of cheesy pick-up line like  "You know, if you were coffee grounds, you would be an espresso cause you're so fine." Why the talk about beauty and coffee? 

I ended up coming to Home Cafe after seeing all the beautiful pictures of their rainbow latte (and other latte's).

First thing I did (besides going to the bathroom) was ordering the Rainbow (Vanilla) Latte. I didn't even bother to look at the other items (although they have a pretty hefty selection).

It was freaking beautiful. I literally could not drink it. I was staring at it for straight five minutes and proceeded to stare at it after every sip (hoping that the design wouldn't go away). On top of looking beautiful, the Vanilla Latte was pretty delicious (smooth, slightly deep/rich, and sweet). $5ish is pricy (but a lot of places, not just in SF, charge about that much for a Latte).

The service was efficient and friendly. The cafe itself is clean and spacious. The location is somewhat random (between two homes--haha get it--on Clement), but it's not hard to find (besides the fact that the font for their cafe name "Home" is pretty small).
author: Christine H.

description:
Overall, I'm never disappointed in the service and drinks at the original Home Cafe on Noriega and this one on Clement has proven to be just as great! Five stars for friendly staff and nice, clean tables.

I felt adventurous and tried the Godzilla (shot of matcha + sparkling water), which was super refreshing. If the weather hadn't been so windy and cold that day, the Godzilla would have been a perfect summer drink. My friend got the Matcha Latte with almond milk, and I'm impressed that they were able to still make a cute bear latte art with almond milk! (I'm also sure the matcha latte doesn't disappoint as well!).

One thing I wish was that the tables were spaced out just a tiny bit more and that the cafe wasn't so crowded, but I guess it can't be helped with how popular it has become! There seems to be a fairly empty backroom/storage area where I feel they could place another large table or a few smaller ones as well.

Overall, I would definitely come back, I still have yet to try the Insta-famous birthday cake latte!
author: Victoria W.

description:
I rarely write reviews, but I have to borrow my husband's account to rave about this place "Home"...

What a wonderful neighborhood place! Even though my girlfriend and I are probably not their usual demographic, all the staff there was super friendly and helpful our first time there.  Staff was knowledgeable about the menu and patiently explained the different items and our options. (Unlike a certain restaurant near the theater in Japantown...very snotty hostess who looked me up and down, told me to come back in 20 minutes even though others were sitting and waiting for a table during happy hour...felt like Eleanor Young, just wish I could've gone back and bought the place!)

I will highly recommend Home to friends of all ages. Good selection of drinks and food items. Plenty of tables, nice modern space. Toast was good, and my drink...the barista is an artist! I hope Home does well at this location.
author: Rich W.

description:
This hipster cafe is definitely Instagram-worthy, and I love it! The place is quite small, but the interior is really cute and they have free wifi. It's a great place to just enjoy your coffee with friends or to get some work done if you can find yourself a table. 

The baristas are super friendly and they have a pretty big drinks selection on their menu. The hot drinks are a lot prettier than the cold drinks. I got their birthday cake latte, which was super aesthetic and colorful. The latte was pretty sweet, but that's how I like it, so I would adjust the sweetness if you're not into that. 

I would definitely come back to try their other flavored lattes. Also very excited to try their toasts!
author: Shirlene C.

description: Excellent place for a pick me up in the afternoon. The staff are very nice and inviting.
author: Manny G.

description:
A hip place to grab coffee or avocado toast. The ambiance is nice, with little succulents decorating the marble tabletops. Cute interior. They have a few tables toward the front of the place that says no electronics/laptops allowed, which I think is a great touch to get people talking and also make sure there's space for customers just trying to get a drink. The front few tables are usually crowded, but there's more space towards the back. Outlets are spaced throughout and there's free wifi, so I often come here with a friend or two to churn out some work. 

The drinks are especially cute and aesthetic! I've gotten the Cookie Monster and Holy Cow lattes before. Loved the little chocolate chip cookies they put in the Cookie Monster. The Holy Cow latte is made with regular milk fused with condensed milk, and I love the combination. You can definitely distinctly taste the condensed milk. The entire drink is smooth and creamy. Drinks are roughly $5 each, so leaning towards the more expensive side for coffee.
author: Karen Y.

description:
The decor of this place is the cutest! The menu is so interesting with items like an iced sparkling Americano and birthday latte. The staff are all so nice and cheery. They take time to explain menu items and asks questions diligently to make sure you get exactly what you want. This place makes me so happy that is worth paying the extra bucks for coffee and ambience. 

Today, I got an iced coconut vanilla latte with oatmeal milk with only 50% sweetness. I've heard of oatmeal milk but never tried it before. When I was told that it was an option, the lovely lady taking my order gave me a little bit of it to try in a cute little shot mug. It ended up being really delicious because it made my latte a little creamy but not sweet. My friend got a hot lavender latte with oatmeal milk. I had a sip of it and was pleasantly surprised that it didn't taste soapy at all. It was also delicious. We were both really impressed. 

To top off our delicious coffees, we also tried the mochi muffin from Third Culture Donuts, which they carry in the shop. The muffins had an interesting texture and the flavor was yummy and not too sweet. It went really well with the sweetness of the lattes. Next time, I'll probably try some of their toast options. 

The best part, it's only a few blocks away from me! So, I can just walk here. They also okay good music here! Home sweet home!
author: Ai E.

description:
Unique and fun drinks!! This was the first coffee shop that I've been to where they do coffee art in COLOR!!! As soon as I saw photos of their drinks on Instagram, I knew I had to check them out! I ordered the Birthday Cake latte, which is the one that comes in color. It has great flavor but definitely a lot of sugar in it! I'd recommend getting 1/2 or 1/3 of the sugar! 

Definitely worth a stop if your in San Francisco!
author: Andrew A.

description:
Cute little neighborhood spot for tea, coffee and toasts.
Staff was super friendly.
Ordered the Br-avo toast and Lavender Jasmine Tea Latte. Both were delish. Tea wasn't too overpowering with lavender and the toast was a nice thick crunchy outside with a softer inside. Good amount of toppings on it as well. 
Definitely will be back to try more
author: Kehaulani K.

description:
I have been to both locations and both are great, but I think I like this location a little better.  This one has more seating and the ambience is a little more chill. Parking can be a pain for both stores but the coffee is worth the hassle.  The girl who helped me was incredibly sweet and made my experience that much better. I took my bff here for a birthday latte and she loved it. I've had the coconut vanilla latte hot and iced and both versions are so good. They also carry the mochi muffin (gluten free) which I always get unless they are sold out.

Fun coffee shop to visit when you're in the city.
author: Mel L.

description:
Adorable cafe with lovely offerings in regards to both toasts and drinks. I've since been to both locations in SF, but, like others have said before me, I like this location just a bit more.

My friend and I came here for a quick pick-me-up after a long day of driving around the city. Compared to Home on Noriega, this one is spacious and has plenty of seating. I love the intimate atmosphere of effervescent conversation and soft 90s jams in the background.

The service here is wonderful, they really try to make you feel comfortable and catered to. While ringing up my order, the cashier was asking me about my hometown, paying customers compliments, cracking jokes-- and it felt very genuine ^_^

We found a table easily near the back, where it seems like they recently expanded a storage room for more seating. Decor here was sparse and packages lined the opposite wall... The freezer and exposed supplies felt sloppy. Kinda takes you out of the ~cute cafe~ atmosphere, which is like, what I'm paying for LOL. I'm guessing they're still working on it.

COOKIE MONSTER LATTE: Not too sweet, not too bitter, wish there were more cookies lol. Hints of cookie butter that are just sweet enough to balance out the espresso. They can sub out their whole milk for a bit extra if you're lactose-intolerant. Still a delicious latte that kicked up my energy.

SEOUL MUCH AVO: Avocado and kimchi together is surprisingly delicious. I like that the creamy, subtle avocado spread balances out the fiery kimchi (not sure if this is ~authentic~ kimchi though lol). The pine nuts add a great crunch! Very picture-worthy~ But I would say that the other location has better toasts. The bread itself is a little tough to chew and cut though, maybe because they use brioche. At least it wasn't cold.

It looks like the back patio is in the works to accommodate for more seating, so I might drop by to check it out in the future.
author: Emmeline W.

description:
The Art of Coffee!

Thank you Instagram for bringing this place to my attention. This coffee place promises happiness. You'll find coffee in a different kind of variations: with Nutella, lavender, red velvet, birthday cake, etc. 

Each creative coffee is a hand-crafted piece of art.
I felt in love with the rainbow-colored birthday cake latte ($5). The taste is vanilla & hazelnut. Also the Nutella latte ($5)conquered my heart. Yes, you read correctly: NUTELLA Latte! It absolutely tastes like Nutella and you can find some Nutella at the bottom of your cup.

After having tried all these different creations, I didn't want to leave without getting the Rose Latte. No regrets at all. Turned out this one was my favorite flavor. Not too sweet, not too intense. Just perfect. Served with dried rose pedals.

Next time, I definitely want to try the Lavender Latte.

This is definitely a place to bring your friends, family and visitors to brag how cool coffee in San Francisco can be!
author: Stefani K.

description:
Their birthday cake latte actually reminds me of a birthday cake! I was so impressed by how pretty the latte looked too. Not going to lie, I saw so many pictures of this pretty latte on instagram which is how I learned about this coffee shop. 

This location had a lot of space on a Saturday afternoon, and I was able to try their avocado toast as well, which was pretty delicious. Next time I come I'll try some of their other specialty lattes (cookie monster latte? That sounds amazing)
author: Theresa L.

description:
"Welcome Home!" 
Not sure I've ever come across a cafe with such amazing customer service (not to mention fantastic coffee). 

To start, everyone was very kind and made a fantastic effort to make sure to clean jugs and tools that had been used for almond milk before preparing a birthday cake latte for my nut allergic friend. Secondly they also went out of their way to help everyone get seated comfortably. 

The drinks themselves were extraordinary. I've seen few cafes with such a great choice of niche coffees. A popular choice is the Birthday Cake latte which is both a work of art as well as a flavourful latte. 
Their London Fog was great, as well as all the normal lattes. 

It was a very pleasant experience and really nice to hang out and chat.
author: Mati K.

description:
I stopped by here on a weekday morning in an attempt to get some work done.  As I arrived, it was pretty busy with many people working on computers and no available seating.  I ordered the Birthday Cake Latte. The latte was decent.  Very cool looking with a little sweetness but nothing life changing  After I got my order, I was able to fit myself in at a communal table to work for a bit.  But, I thought it was hilarious to see a group of younger girls ask to borrow part of our table to take photos, get excited seeing what my drink looked like, ask to take a photo of my drink and eventually sit on the floor.  

Overall, I thought this was a cool place to get work done if you could actually find a seat.  I would definitely think about adding this to the rotation.
author: Mitch T.

description:
Like the original location, this Home serves coffee, tea, and snacks! I was pleasantly surprised by this location because it was such a bigger space than the one on Noriega. Fortunately, my bf and I were able to find a table at around 1 pm in the afternoon. 

They have more toasts on the menu here! I was happy to see 2 type of avocado toasts (the #basic in me lmao), a lucky charms toast (whaaaa??), and a matcha strawberry toast! I will definitely need to go back to try those. I ordered a bacon/corn toast with a birthday cake latte and my bf ordered the abbs of toast that came with almond butter, strawberries and bananas. We also tried a matcha black sesame tea cake, which reminded me of a cupcake (not really sure what the difference is lol). It had a good matcha flavor with some black sesame on top. Yum!!

The service is really friendly! I need to come back to try all the toasts!
author: Tara A.

description:
Randomly decided to come here with my friend with the help of our handy dandy yelp app. 

The actual shop is very modern and clean. They do have a lot of creative flavors which drew us here. They also offer almond milk and soy milk which is a plus (got to keep us lactose intolerant homies happy too)! 

Anyway, the baristas were all friendly and smiling, definitely something I look for when I'm in a coffee shop. I ordered their iced coconut vanilla latte and my friend ordered their iced Cookie Monster (Cookie Butter) latte. 

When our drinks were ready they were aesthetically pleasing to look at! For all you IG foodies out there this place is instagrammable. 

Now for the taste. I was somewhat disappointed in my Iced coconut vanilla latte. I was definitely missing the vanilla part of my drink. But it did have that coconut taste. I tried my friends cookie butter latte and that was tasty. The Cookie Crisp cereal topping was a whimsical addition to her drink. 

Both drinks were $5. A bit pricey for me, but worth it for the service and the instagram photos.

Would I come back? Eh, yeah. I wouldn't go out of my way to come back but if I were in the neighborhood I'd probably stop by.
author: Jonathan A.

description:
I won't lie, I came here specifically for the rainbow latte (birthday cake latte) and it was well worth it. They use whole milk and the latte is sweeter than usual but they give you the option of adding or removing sugar if you want - I went with the way they serve it. It was exactly as the barista told me it would be, so if you're a cream-only coffee drinker, remove the sugar all together

The cafe in general offers a variety of coffee drinks as well as food if you're not interested in one of their speciality drinks. They omit a very chill / calm ambiance and welcome you with hospitality. I personally enjoy their music playlist (this morning it was early 2000's hip hop, I drank my coffee to Ashanti) I may have been led there for the photo but in general enjoy the cafe and recommend!
author: Angella G.

description:
Welcoming from the start! I love that it is called HOME - if I lived much closer I would call it my second home  
Ordered the toast with the cereal! So fun! Sweet and would be a good pair with a non-sweet latte or coffee. But ended up ordering the Rose latte - AH MAZING- I felt like I was back in Europe on my latte expedition:) 
My sister ordered the lavender latte, very dainty and beautifully presented, and my friend ordered the Cookie Monster latte. All fun lattes, beautiful clean ambiance for a Saturday morning, great for talks or chill by yourself cafe:) have fun!
author: Ruth Awit S.

description:
Finally got to try this place after seeing so many pictures of the birthday cake latte!!

Came here on a Friday afternoon and it was packed!! However, the cafe wants to incorporate the feeling of "home" when you come here, so they would ask people to share tables. It's a clever idea to try and fit everyone in the small cafe. There's quite a few tables, but this place has been pretty popular so it fills up quickly! They do offer free wifi which is why this is the perfect study place! Parking can be hard to find here, but there are metered parking and some free parking spots. 

Birthday Late: It taste just as good as it looks!! I chose to substitute whole milk with almond milk instead. The sweetness of this latte was just right for me, but you can ask to adjust the sweetness however you like. 

Mint Chip Latte: I had a sip of my friend's drink and I like that the mint chocolate wasn't overpowering the taste of the coffee. 

OVERALL: I will definitely come back here when I have the chance! I finished my latte so fast that I'm itching for more!
author: Jennie Q.

description:
Come for the Insta-worthy pics, stay for the delicious food & drinks!

I'm pretty impressed with this place. For a cafe that has a lot of hype (with a line out the door and virtually zero seats available to prove it), it certainly does a good job of living up to it. I've been here a few times already, and I can say Home is consistent and definitely a welcome addition to the neighborhood.

Some great things about this place:
- super friendly, young (but mature) staff. I feel like my friends work here.
- delicious avo toasts (Let's Avo Cuddle is my fave so far)
- Third Culture bakery pastries readily available
- yummy drinks - I usually just get a plain latte (I'm a grandma and cant do sweet drinks anymore), and I have no complaints
- big windows & picture-worthy (get that perfect flat lay)

Some pain points:
- not much seating available since people like to sit and study/read for a while
- they recently changed their avo toast bread to a thick piece of brioche, which I find is harder to cut/bite. After asking the cashier, I discovered they did this because they received complaints that their previous bread got soggy easily. I appreciate that they listen to their customer feedback, though I don't necessarily love the change.

Overall, the ambiance here is fantastic and it's a great spot for a weekend treat. I love supporting local cafes like these so I will continue to visit when I'm in the area!
author: Alyssa T.

description:
I really wanted to love this place, especially with how long I've been waiting to go, but my entire experience was honestly pretty meh. I got the birthday latte (because I had to see about all the rave), lavender latte, Mochi muffin, and cereal toast. I think they must have either been getting a lot of complaints or people saying the lattes are too sweet, because the cashier warned me about the sweetness and asked me if I wanted to adjust it. I'm not too big of a fan of sweet coffee, so I adjusted both to low sweetness. 

When I got my birthday latte, I was surprised by how sweet it still was, and lacked coffee taste. On coffee standards, I wasn't too big of a fan. I definitely didn't feel like I got my caffeine fix. The lavender latte was better, but still pretty sweet and the tea itself wasn't that strong. The only thing that made it taste strongly of lavender were the lavender seeds on top. The food, I was more of a fan of. I have had the Mochi muffin before, so I really liked that. The toast was very simple, but tasty, but much too sweet with my coffee. Maybe I will go with a black coffee next time with the toast. Overall, not such a great experience, felt a little sick with all that sugar intake. I will have to try my experience with a different type of coffee next time.
author: Julie Y.

description:
First time here with a friend, but I could already tell this would be a great place to study! It is spacious, and the interior design is quite cute. The customer service is fantastic, no matter how many questions we ask... 

We tried the drinks only, but they are absolutely beautiful. I ordered the cookie monster latte, and my friend the red velvet latte. Everything is perfect, but my drink was too bitter for my tasting. The cookie bits were good though. 

Will definitely come again to try the food and other drinks!
author: Melinda T.

description: This place is soo cute. I came here while I was visiting SF and I've never seen any lattes that looked like a rainbow. Me and my friend got the rainbow latte which was a little too sweet. For me and I got the Lavander soy latte.
author: Anina M.

description:
If you're looking for aesthetic coffee, this is THE PLACE. The lattes and toasts are so beautiful! The baristas here really are super skilled. 

A friend and I tried the birthday cake latte, the chocolate mint latte, and the avocado toast. The lattes were around $4-5 and the toast was $7.75, which I thought was a really good deal considering the amount of avocado they pack on. 

The birthday cake latte is actually a work of art. I felt bad taking sips of it because it was so pretty! It has a really sweet vanilla flavor though, so it's probably not for everyone. I also tried the chocolate mint latte, which was amazing and less sweet than the birthday cake latte. 

The avocado toast is served on a thick slab of brioche and is super delicious. I think they have 3 different versions of it on the menu; I got the one with arugula and tomato but I definitely want to try the kimchi one in the future! 

Seating is a little hard to get because the cafe is not that large, but if you manage to snag a table this is the perfect spot for a cute, light brunch.
author: Melissa H.

description:
I'm a sucker for cute things so I decided to make the trek to Outer Richmond to get my bear latte on. To be honest, this place is a solid 3 stars if we are solely talking about their lattes, but their service was friendly so I will bump it up to a 4. The cashier was really accommodating when I asked if they can draw a bear on my cookie monster latte and they were super nice about it.

I was surprised that their lattes aren't that sweet and that kinda hampered my experience. I wasn't experiencing "Starbucks style" sweetness, but the taste was very meh. 

Home is definitely somewhere you go for the "environment", but not for the drinks or food. I wouldn't make the trip again to try Home, but if I was in the area, I would be curious to try their lavender latte which I heard is quite good.
author: Eva L.

description:
I have been following these guys on Instagram for over a year now. The visual appeal of the coffee and food served here made me fall in love with the place even before I actually went there. 

So when I finally visited the cafe last week, it was like I've already been here. Home SF completely lived up to my expectations. There is no doubt that their baristas are probably some of the best ones in the city. Their coffee art is mind blowing. And the fact that their coffees even tasted great just made this the perfect coffee house!
My husband and I got the ROSE LATTE and the BIRTHDAY CAKE COFFEE. The art on both was as expected - STUNNING! The Rose Latte had a beautiful, not too overwhelming rose flavor with dried rose petals sprinkled on top. While the Birthday Cake Coffee was colorful and sweet as it should be.

The prices are very reasonable for the quality and quantity they serve. Definitely a winner of a cafe for me! I'm definitely going back for more.
author: Ishani S.

description: Came here to meet with a friend for coffee! Heard a lot about this place and finally stopped by. It a really cute place with nice ambiance and great drinks. There is a variety of seating and a lot of it. It's great to meet with a friend or to do work on a weekday when it's a bit slower.  There is a big menu with lots of speciality drinks. I went with a matcha which I really enjoyed. I'd highly recommend this spot and I will surely be back again to try other stuff in the menu.
author: Andrea W.

description:
I wish I had a Home coffee shop when I was in university. Granted at that time we didn't have Instagram to post beautiful pictures but hey I had a point and shoot camera which could take pictures (but I'd have to wait to develop them!). In this age of camera phones and social media one can immediately record one's coffee/meal/views before leaving the restaurant. Which is why Home is THE place to be for the ultimate hangout.

We went late in the afternoon and I literally stood there gawking at the menu for a good 5 minutes because I wanted everything. Literally everything. I finally chose Sea Salt Caramel Hot Chocolate and Seoul Much Avocado toast (with kimchi, sunflower seeds and sesame seeds). Luckily for us we scored the last toast of the day! My dear friend got the Birthday Cake Latte which is ubiquitous to Home but since I don't drink coffee she "took one for the team."

All the tables were full in the front so we sat in the back which was a little odd - one large shared table and a two top. There was a lot of room in the back for more tables but whatever reason they chose not to fill it. 

Our order came out in a decent amount of time so of course we had to ooh and ahh how pretty our order was and take lots of photos to post on IG. The latte was *almost* too pretty to drink! I originally wanted to try the Seoul Much avo toast but I had just eaten a large lunch and couldn't eat any more. My friend loved it and said it was one of the best she's had. She also loved her birthday cake latte and my sea salt caramel hot chocolate thankfully wasn't too sweet. 

Service was super friendly and we both commented if we lived close we would be here nearly every day to go through the menu.

I am going to have the Nutella Hot Chocolate next time and will make room for any kind of avo toast Home offers...
author: Nette T.

description:
Home is very trendy and aesthetically pleasing place for coffee. All the tables are marbled and pictures can be potentially IG worthy for all people looking to take cute pictures. Their drinks are very pretty and well decorated. I ordered an avocado toast, I'm not sure if it was only this day but it was VERY salty, I was having a hard time eating it. As for the matcha cupcake item, it was quite yummy! 

I saw someone drinking a fresh coconut and decided to order it (not pictured) and let me tell you, that coconut was pretty darn good. The meat in it was also very soft to scoop out with the spoon so if I come back I will definitely get the coconut again!
author: Yenni H.

description: This is the first time I've ever had a latte at a cafe like this and man I was blown away. I have no idea what kinda black magic is involved to make the lattes look like this but I love it. It was really good too! I love the vibes of this cafe, it's very cute and aesthetic and clean!
author: Steven Z.

description: This place is very cute, but definitely a novelty coffee shop. The prices are high and it's filled with very young customers trying to instagram every angle of their order.  I think it's a good place to meet a friend to talk over a pretty coffee drink, but the food items are limited to avocado toast and pastries so not a brunch spot.
author: Sarah S.

description:
I love it! People are super nice, the coffee is so cute and it's good too
I love how they pay attention to details and their unique flavors
author: Alondra R.

description: Really really cute spot! The coffee was good but the latte art was better. 100% worth it for the insta photos
author: Hannah W.

description:
I don't really head up to SF often, but when I do I always want to try the "hip" places. My friends found this on and decided we all needed to go there - if not for the instagrammable drinks, but for the incredible looking avocado toast. I caved and got both a latte and an avocado toast. My wallet was a little sad, but my tastebuds were very happy. 

I was debating on getting the rainbow latte, but in the end went for a rose latte since I usually don't see many places with that. And I can get a vanilla/hazelnut latte (although without rainbows) elsewhere. The rose latte was ever so slightly rose infused and it was perfect! I think you have to like rose in order to enjoy it, but I wouldn't say it was overly powerful if you're on the fence of trying it. 

I also pondered on the different toasts offered, but in the end I went with the Bravo Toast. Who can say no to bacon? Bacon is always a good choice. I also love radishes and sprouts so this one seemed like a no brainer to me. I love that it comes on a thick piece of bread rather than a thin piece. It's substantial and pairs well with all the goodness piled on top. I've been thinking about this toast for a while and am convinced I need to re-create it at home myself.

This space is pretty big so it shouldn't be too difficult to find a seat for you and your friends. The line also moves rather quickly so don't be alarmed if it goes out the door! In fact, your food will probably even be ready before your drink :) Definitely give it a try if you're in the area!
author: Cindy Y.

description:
Best customer services and latte art I've experienced hands down. 
Make sure you ask the barista for the latte art and there specialty, made everything more personable experience. 
The Nutella latte was smooth and bold just the way I like it
author: Amy C.

description: Lattes not too sweet, drinks and decor Instagram worthy. Cute spot and drinks were too freaking cute. Street parking only and certain tables had no laptop signs on them which was nice. Gives others a seating chance who want to hang out with their friends and catch up over coffee. I got the red velvet latte. Slight red velvet flavor, mainly milky, light sweet and I can't really recall any red velvet flavor. My friend got the birthday latte (rainbow colors) should just be a unicorn latte. Not sure what drives the design. We got the usual flowers but the lady next to us who paid no attention to her drink got a cute ass teddy bear... smh... she let it just sit there for a good half hour while we kept looking over at it. We are young instagrammers damnit! Guess it's another excuse to come by and get more lattes.
author: Lindsay C.

description:
Such a instagram worthy cup of coffee! 

It gets super crowded with college students taking up space with their laptops. Rarely do I see a full available table, so it's ok to ask strangers to share a table with them. 

I really like the birthday latte. It's rainbow colored, picture perfect. It not only looked beautiful but tastes delicious. 

The toast is tasty as well. I recommend the meatball with tomato and pesto and a fried egg on top. Soooo good. 


If a relaxing quiet place to enjoy a cup of coffee is what you're looking for, this is probably not the place to go. But a delicious instagram worthy cup of coffee is it!
author: AJ C.

description: Stopped by here one morning since it's in my old neighborhood and so happy I did! The baristas at the front were so kind and helpful and helped me pock out the birthday cake latte - sooooo good and so beautiful! I almost didn't want to drink it! It's a cute place in Richmond District. Hopefully get to stop by again!
author: Henna S.

description:
Cute little place. I was visiting a friend who lives in the area (since i'm from NYC) and I took a walk here. The latte was good, and the almond butter toast was tasty and stacked on fresh, tasty brioche toast. 

Staff wasn't over friendly, but i'd still say it was worth the walk, especially for the toast!
author: Amany N.

description:
I cannot believe how long it took me to try Home.
My first visit I tried the Birthday Cake Latte with soy, less sweet, and the Matcha Toast. 
The latte was covered in sprinkles just the way I love it! The atmosphere is so clean and bright. The latte was delicious with just the right amount of sweetness, and it had my name written with the foam! It was just a magical experience!
The matcha toast was sweet, and very sticky. It was delicious, but a bit hard to eat because the toast was so very thick and hard to cut without a sharp knife. That being said I've gotten it twice so it hasn't stood in my way.

I tried one of the croissants, but I wasn't very pleased with the texture and flavor. It did not have the distinct crispy layers of pastry, and didn't taste like it was made fresh that day. 

I've also tried the Lavender Latte and Mint choco chip latte and love them both! I'll be back!
author: Larissa S.

description:
I love love this place! The ambiance is very nice and you also have the option to sit and play on your laptop. However, they tend to get very busy on the weekends.

I really enjoyed the rainbow latte and the savory toasts! The lattes are delicious and make for a great picture. The only downside is that my one slice of toast came out to be $9 because I added cheese to it.
author: Helen z.

description:
Everything about this place is so perfect. I love local coffee and this place is one of the reasons why. 
As a barista for one of the big chain coffee shops, places like these make me want to switch over to local coffee places back home. The coffee was extremely well priced, the workers (would the be baristas here?) were all so friendly, and the coffee quality was perfect.
10/10 would come back if we lived in the area
author: Alana B.

description:
This little cafe packs quite a punch. I came because of the pretty latte designs. I just had to know if it was as good as it looks. 

We came and was able to find street parking right on front of the shop! My husband ordered a red velvet latte, banana almond butter toast and a mango custard. I ordered the birthday cake latte and a green custard. 

Both lattes had a smooth coffe taste. It wasn't overpowered by sugar and sweetness. It tasted great with or without the pastries. I was worried that it was going to be more like a sugar showdown in a cup, but it wasn't. Perfect coffee blend with espresso and the pretty designs  made it a perfect cup of coffee! 

The pastries were really good too. I loved the toast and the mango custard the most. I was only supposed to try the toast and I ended up eating the whole thing (oops! My bad hubby, My bad.) 

Overall, this place is true to the hype. Great service, great food, great lattes!
author: Aggie C.

description:
On a recent trip to the Bay Area, I was craving my Seattle coffee something fierce. One of our friends excitedly took us to his favourite neighbourhood coffeehouse. There was parking in front (wait, what?!) and we walked right inside. 

The baristas at the front counter were super friendly and their menu board was packed with coffee and tea drinks, non-caffeinated beverages, and ice cream. While I was waiting for my drink, I noticed that they also sold toast. Yup, this hipster joint has overpriced toast ($6 - $9.50) made with rustic French bread that comes in 5-6 varieties with slightly twee names. I didn't partake in any because paying six dollars plus for toast feels a little wrong...

Onto the coffee! For my first coffee, I ordered their sea-salted caramel latte with soy and when I took a sip, it was delicious. I also bought one of their cookies - a freshly baked melty cornflake thing. Yes, it was delicious too. On a subsequent visit, I had their coconut vanilla latte (also with soy) and was very pleased. 

If I lived in this particular SFO neighbourhood, I'd definitely make this my local. Decent prices for the coffee and tasty baked treats. The space was roomy and I noticed quite a few outlets for laptops and the like.
author: Kristine H.

description: More than just Instagram gold. This place made me so happy! The guy at the cash register was so friendly and lovely, the various toasts were so well done and the lattes were delicious. They nailed it from start to finish and I'm so thrilled that they put effort into every part of their business and don't rely on just their pretty drinks. The coconut latte was delicious and the bravo and the say cheese were insane! So pumped to live so close to this place!
author: Katie S.

description: Blew away expectations. The espresso was delicious and the service was great. I was taking my order to go and I found there wasn't a good place to wait, but I was definitely happy once my stuff was given to me.
author: Bobby C.

description: Great coffee even with all the bells and whistles, cute interior, delicious toast and friendly staff! I only wish I lived closer so I could go more often.
author: Lauren G.

description:
Finally a place that makes cute lattes without jeopardizing how it tastes.

Three other people and I stumbled upon this place after brunch.  When we arrived on a Sunday around 11am there was a short line.  It was a hot day so most of us got cold drinks.  I was instantly impressed by their "Creative" menus.  I ended up getting a Salted Caramel Almond Milk Latte ($4.50) off that menu.  It was perfect.  It had the perfect amount of sweetness and milk.  It was delicious and wasn't too strong.  I also tried their Iced Cookie Monster Latte which came out with tons of little chocolate chip cookies on top.  It tasted like cookie butter and wasn't too sweet at all.  I liked it a lot.  The other people I came with got a regular black iced coffee and a hot Nutella Latte.  Everyone was pretty happy with their drinks.  

They do some pretty impressive drinks with beautiful presentation here.  Their hot drinks are much more fancier looking than their cold drinks.  Their most popular is the colorful Birthday Cake Latte.  I will need to come back and try that.  Their drinks run from $3 to $5.  It's an additional $.50 for almond or soy milk.  They also have some brunch items and pastries.  

The inside of this place is cute and modern looking.  It has an open and casual feel.  There is another place to have brunch or hang out in the back.  The girl at the register was very nice.  Although it was pretty busy we got our drinks soon after we ordered.  I would definitely recommend and cannot wait to go back.
author: Cat N.

description:
Lavender latte was so good. And the server was super friendly. Marble table makes good background for photos. 
Definitely will come back if I can, and order the same thing
author: Emily P.

description: So incredibly in love with this place. It was in my destiny to come here. I had this place bookmarked when I was home-- haha pun not really intended. But anyway, I wasn't able to go Bc I was so busy with a conference. My flight was supposed to be yesterday evening and it ended up getting cancelled. I got to spend an extra day in sf and come check this place out which ended being walking distance from where I was already so didn't even have to pay for an Uber...like I said, destiny. I got the almond butter toast. It was sweet but not too sweet. Also the fruits on top were freshly cut and the whole thing was just really good esp if you like almond butter. I also got the birthday cake latte. It was BEAUTIFUL first of all. It was really sweet but I'm into that so I loved it. I had a good conversation with a friend too so that made the experience even better. I can't wait to come back to San Fran and come back here.
author: Komal S.

description: Such an adorable selection of drinks! I wish I could get them all just to see the designs they come up with. It's a bit crowded, but I'm definitely coming back!
author: Angelina H.

description:
The hype is real with this place and I'm so glad it is just a few blocks away from my in-laws! It has now made my "must do" list whenever I'm in SF.

This is a pretty big coffee shop with lots of table and seating. However, the two times I've been there on my last trip it was always packed. I like the fact that they put signs on a few tables saying "no laptops here". It really helps because I've sat at those tables twice. If it weren't for those signs, I can see there being no tables available at all. And I can see why! I can totally spend hours here as well as the vibe is so chill with good music, friendly staff and nice decor.

So the coffee... I tried the holy cow, birthday cake and chocolate mint latte. They were ALL so good, I would order all of them again. For the instagrammer, birthday cake is a must. I've seen that the cookie monster is another good one for pictures.

Food: I've had the Br-avo and the a bb's of toast. Again, both were so good! Even though you can definitely make these at home, they are pretty tasty. 

Parking is rough for the area. But what area in SF has great parking right? But it is definitely worth spending 20 minutes looking for parking. Yes, its that good!
author: Heather O.

description:
Very well made drinks.
Some are too pretty to drink.
The noise level in the place can be deafening.
The back room is kind of empty ... could use more table and chair.
author: S.K. Y.

description: I'm so glad this cafe is in my neighborhood! Adorable drinks, great atmosphere and friendly service. The first time I went I tried the cookie latte and loved the creamy taste without being overly sweet. At the bottom of my mug was a little layer of cookie butter which was appreciated. The next time I tried the birthday cake latte which was also not too sweet while still being tasty. I split two toasts with my friend the strawberry matcha and the avo cuddle. I will say I preferred the avocado one but it was fun trying both. The aesthetic of the cafe is so cute and a great place to hang.
author: Chelsea T.

description:
I'd been dying to try Home after seeing their colorful lattes and picture perfect toasts on IG. I didn't realize the Home Richmond location serves toast only on gluten free bread *CRYING EMOJI*. It's thin, soft and fresh, slightly chewy, but I prefer my bread thick and gluten-full.

Also, the drink combinations sounded so cute and delicious but overall I did not enjoy most of them.

Food/Drink Review:
* Avocado Kimchi Toast - 4 stars: This flavor combo was excellent, and the toast didn't bother me. Would order again! 
* Matcha Strawberry Toast - 2 stars: Condensed milk overwhelmed the thin toast. Way too sweet, barely tasted the matcha. 
* Coconut Latte - 1 star: Tasted like Flavia coffee (very artificial).
* Condensed Milk Latte - 3.5 stars: Tasty but nothing special 
* Cookie Butter Latte - 4 stars: I generally dislike sweet drinks but this was beautiful AND delicious! I liked how distinct the Speculoos flavor was and downed the entire thing. 

Overall, I like how spacious and modern this new location is. They have fun drink and toast flavor combinations, but they were a bit too sweet and overhyped in my opinion. Worth a visit to #eatfortheinsta, and would recommend the original Home location in the Sunset for toast instead.
author: Jess C.

description:
Home is such a cute breakfast spot! The place isn't hard to find but parking can be a pain. We got lucky finding parking as well as finding a seat inside the place. The ambiance of the place was really nice and wasn't loud at all. It was also very spacious, so they could possibly add more tables and chairs.

I ordered Br-Avo with hot chocolate and my friend got Abb's of Toast with a latte. My Br-Avo tasted delicious but it's definitely over-priced since I could have definitely made it at home (maybe that's why they named it Home, haha). My hot chocolate looked super cute but it wasn't hot which was kinda sad. My friend enjoyed her meal as well! Her toast was super sweet and she loved how they designed her latte. 

Definitely won't mind coming back here but definitely not an everyday go-to place, it's too expensive for that.
author: Sheila C.

description: Everything in the menu is great, JUST DON'T  SEAT at the tables with signs no laptop allowed. They will ask you to move. It doesn't matter if you get multiple drinks and food during your stay, they WILL kick you out of your seat.  I'd advice not to drive here, maybe take uber, there's a paid meter outside. pay meter spot( $2/hour).
author: Feevee O.

description: I've never had so much trouble picking out a coffee. There are so many options and they all sounded amazing! I had a salted caramel latte and it was perfect. The staff was lovely and greeted me with "welcome home." I stumbled upon it while walking to the Legion of Honor. If you decide to make the trek walking the. Definitely stop at Home to recharge. Loved it.
author: Kathryn M.

description:
Home is a really cozy cafe with some seating for working and some for non-working. What i mean by that is that some tables don't allow you to have your laptops there, so it's reserved for people who are meeting up for a quick chat! I think that's awesome. The staff was also extremely nice and informative!

Anyways, Home has very unique coffee drinks that many be a little more expensive than your average cup o' joe. It carries the famous "rainbow latte" and other really cool flavors like red velvet, cookie monster, etc. 

My sister and I tried the rainbow latte and the iced lavender latte. Both had very unique flavor profiles. The rainbow latte was a vanilla tasting latte made with condensed milk - beware: it is pretty sweet but I appreciated the time they took to put the sprinkles on the drink. It was SO instagrammable... LOL The lavender latte was floral and really simply delicious. I think I liked it more since I'm a big fan of lavender. The people next to me got the cookie latte and it was so cute and shaped like a bear! 

Definitely had quality coffee here but not something that would be good to my everyday go-to since it's pricey.
author: Anna L.

description: I really enjoyed Home. I got a matcha with brown sugar and it was amazing and also a cookie and cream latte. I love the vibes here and am excited to go back.
author: Tina L.

description: Honestly this place could serve anything and they will still have teenagers lining up at their door taking pictures for their instagram because of their whimsical drinks. I felt like the menu was written by a child deprived of sugar their whole lives. The space is great for the neighborhood (although I think they can make more use of their back room/patio) but I got the hot chocolate and avo-cuddle toast and it was just OK (go to Nourish or As Quoted for GREAT avo toast). It's a little overwhelming in terms of noise so I wouldn't come during popular times if you're looking for a quiet place to work.
author: Tiffany L.

description: Delicious food, loved the millionaires bacon, everything our group ordered was amazing, will definitely return on my next visit to the city
author: Mary W.

description:
I couldn't wait to try Home after reading all the reviews and seeing all the great pics on Instagram.   Finding the spot was easy, however parking was another story.   After circling the block a few times, we decided to park a few blocks away and walk.  And got the record, I would've walked another few blocks to go!!!!   

Walked into the adorable Coffee shop & was greeted by the barista who was super nice & friendly.   Loved the ambiance & vibe of the place.  

I couldn't decide between the Birthday Cake Latte & the Lavender Latte so I got BOTH!!!!  The Birthday Cake Latte was heaven!  Vanilla & Hazelnut (my two favorite) along with the adorable rainbow design was pure happiness in a cup!!!   I got the Iced Lavender Latte with an extra shot  to go!   It was delicious to the last drop!  

I can't wait to go back the next time I'm in SF.   The hardest part is deciding what to try next!
author: Shannon D.

description: I really enjoyed this quiet and delicious cafe! It has a really nice ambiance and the staff is super friendly! I would come again and a great place to study. I didn't go to the back area but I'm sure it's nice too. The lattes were super cute and super insta worth!
author: Erineo G.

description:
Study spot? - yes
Catch up spot? - yes
Overly priced but beautifully delicious latte art that you cannot justify buying but buy anyways because its #instagramworthy - hell yes

To all my college friends out there who cannot justify paying 5 bucks for a latte, the cheapest thing on the menu is their pure coffee drip. Snag yourself one of those, camp out on your laptop, and study to your hearts content.

On another note...this location is much bigger than the Sunset location. With its huge windows and endless seats, it is the perfect place to study or catch up with friends! I especially loved  the interior design and marble tabletops...even though that honestly has nothing to do with the quality of the coffee. heh. 

I only come here when I'm feeling extra EXTRA.. Because lets be honest...you can get great coffee for much less. However, the atmosphere here is incredible!
author: Mary L.

description:
Totally fun place to hang out and have a cuppa Java.

Creative and fun drinks.  Specials on the board outside of the store.
author: S F.

description:
I came here because the latte art was so cute! It proved to be just as cute as all of the pictures. However, the environment was so loud and crowded. There weren't enough tables so it seemed like you had to rush to drink your latte so others could have a spot to sit. 

The drink was good and the cookies added a great element. The latte art was the best part but I don't think it was worth the 5.50$ you pay for the drink. 

If the environment was quiet and calm and not as rushed i feel like I'd pay for it again but since it just seemed too crazy I don't think I'll come back.
author: Ash S.

description:
This is my second time here and they do no disappoint! For the food and drinks ofc
Except for the fact there aren't any seats. 
All the seats were taken by single customers on their laptops for God Knows How Long they've been sitting there 
!!HOME MANAGEMENT- You guys should have a seating time limit!! 2.5 hour limit? 
Also share tables for single customers that come in??
My friend have been craving for avocado toast since it's the trend now 
She got the Br-Avo & Birthday cake 
I got the red velvet latte & Abb's of toast 
We loved both, but for me I don't know which to like more; the flat single slice or this huge block toast
author: Fiona B.

description:
Unlike other hipster San Francisco coffee places, the coffee at Home didn't have that awful sour taste when brewed. The location is fantastic because it's a good place to head to while waiting in that ridiculously long line at Dragon Beaux a block away. 

The coffee shop itself is open and gets a tonne of sunlight which makes it perfect on the rare sunny days. The baristas are friendly and you get your coffee in a jiffy.

The menu is interesting too. They have a lot of latte art and interesting flavours which I will have to try next time "for the gram" but this time around I got the basic drip and it hit the spot. 

Very chill, super friendly and not a bad place to hang out if you're ever in the neighbourhood.
author: Eunah T.

description: Such a charming neighborhood coffee shop that makes you feel at home. The coffee is good here. I had the bakery goods. They were alright. Nothing too special. The scallion three cheese scone and the matcha custard one sounded better than it tastes.
author: Arnold W.

description:
Wow! Home is definitely one of my favorite coffee shop! My hubby and I came here after visiting Japanese tea garden. We spent 20 minutes looking for street parking during noon on Sunday. 

When we placing our order, the cashier lady was nice and friendly explain to us about the coffee as this is our first time. We have ordered birthday cake, monster cookies and avocado toast. We waited a little bit for our order and at the same time waiting for seat available. The coffees were ready but we still cannot get the table. And there's one staff came out and helped us out to have a table for us. We're really appreciate for the staffs' attention even though they're busy.

Both drinks were good and smooth. The latte arts on our coffee were so delicate and pretty.  The avocado toast is a must try dish as it has 3 different samplers eg: kimchi, radish and spinach. We like the toast with little Kimchi, it's more flavorful. We're really enjoying our coffee and the toast.

We want to come back here if only we're lucky in searching parking here. We wanted to try something else.
author: Jaane F.

description:
Such a cute hipster (in a good way) cafe in the Richmond district. First things first -- I love how they greeted us. They literally said "welcome Home." Such a fun thing to hear. I came here on a Saturday morning to get a little pick me up and the workers were so sweet. My friend and I were staring at the menu for a few minutes trying to figure out what we wanted (and don't get me wrong there's a lot of drinks on the menu and it was a little overwhelming) and the cashier was so helpful in suggesting what were the popular drinks. 

She spent a good five minutes explaining how their most picture-esque drink was the birthday cake (rainbow) latte or if we liked more flower based drinks, then they offered rose and lavender lattes, each drizzled with actual flower petals. (Note: the rose latte isn't on the menu -- she told me they literally made it for one person on the daily, so even though it wasn't on the board they do offer it!). She suggested if we wanted something refreshing, her favorite drink was the iced chocolate mint latte. 

Overall, the cashier had a ton of suggestions for my friend and I since it was the first time we came (to) Home. I followed her suggestion and got the iced chocolate mint latte for $5.15 (after tax). It's definitely refreshing, but a lot smaller than I had hoped; honestly I think their prices are a little higher because they know people come and do work for hours in their cute little cafe. I would be open to coming to this cafe to get some work done -- especially because its decor is so aesthetically pleasing. (Note: I didn't notice too many outlets around the tables though, so if I do come I'll make sure to bring a charged laptop!)
author: Danielle S.

description:
My wife and I came here looking to sample one of the popular coffee shops in the city. Parking for this place is really difficult to find and you're probably better off booking an uber to get here. The cafe is pretty big, but it's also difficult to find a seat since a lot of people like to take a seat and enjoy their lattes/coffee. The staff is also super friendly and they also helped us find a place to sit. The shop encourages people to enjoy each others company and share tables. They also say no laptops, but don't actively enforce it as there were several who had their laptops out and were tuning out the world.

We ordered the birthday cake latte and cookie butter latte as well as the avocado toast sampler. Both lattes were very tasty and pretty as the baristas detailed the latte art making it so appealing. The birthday cake latte was so colorful and the cookie butter latte had a cute bear design with cookie crisps. If we're back in the city, we'll definitely stop by again.
author: Chris A.

description: A little overpriced but a lot overcute. 4/5 coffee, 5/5 insta. If your feed needs a lil sprucing, this coffee shop is where it's at. Seating is tough though so just take your cup and walk over to North Beach and watch people try to get tan when it's 65 degrees out, it'll be worth it
author: Hareem M.

description:
Home is such a cute coffee shop with various different flavors of typical coffees to some unique flavors. Their shop is clean and surprisingly very big and open with lots of seating, which I appreciate since I usually like to stay and chat with friends. 

I had their Birthday Cake Latte, which the cashier explained to me, does not have a birthday cake flavor, rather a creamy vanilla. Either way, it was a delicious latte with a definite wow factor with its bright colors! I also had their Avo-Cuddle toast with avocado, cherry tomatoes and arugula with some crushed red pepper for breakfast. It was a bit pricey for one piece of toast, but they caked on the avocado and arugula. Lastly, my boyfriend ordered their Cookie Monster which was less sweet and had more of a bitter/coffee flavor than my sweet Birthday Cake. Perfect for him. 

Next time I visit San Francisco, it's definitely a coffee shop I'll have to visit again. Oh and a plus for some tourists/visitors, it's very close to California Academy of Sciences :)
author: Kianna B.

description: A very cute coffee shop. Can easily find street parking around the area. The lavender has a very strong lavender smell to it, so if you're fond of the lavender smell, you should give it a try. If lavender isn't your thing, definitely try coconut vanilla latte. It's a bit sweeter than the lavender latte but not too sweet.
author: Danny N.

description:
I ordered a coffee here on my last SF trip and asked how many shots of espresso it comes with. 2. I asked for a third and welcomed the additional cost. However I was unpleasantly surprised when the cashier told me that they would charge me for 2 extra shots and give me the 1 I requested since they "sell shots in pairs of two."  Apparently since their machine makes 2 at a time they are only sold 2 at a time ....?!?!?  I've visited countless coffee shops and never encountered anything like this. I paid what they asked but will not return. This rating is based purely on this very weird policy. 

Oh and side note, you have to stand around to get a seat. There are not very many tables, and it's usually a busy place. After you get a seat, others waiting stare at you until you leave. Not the customers' fault, but I think a coffee shop should have decent seating.
author: Faisal A.

description:
I love this location of Home! Maybe because since it's new, it's less crowded whenever I've gone (as in I can actually find a seat without fighting!). On top of that, the workers seemed to be friendlier and had thoughtful conversations with us, but maybe that's also because there aren't a million pairs of angry eyes staring at them to rush, so no shade to the other locations! 

The bright atmosphere and colorful drinks always put me in a good mood. There are a bunch of specialty lattes that range from their birthday cake latte to nutella latte, more for those who have a sweet tooth to satisfy. They even offer a cereal toast thats SUPER sweet, so eat small bites and share this (i'm guilty for liking that sweet stuff). You can never go wrong with the avo toast though, in case you don't feel like diabetes today, but def try it out another day!
author: Maleah M.

description:
One day a week, I work within a close enough distance to get here before they shut their doors at 5pm.  I consider Home to my inspirational, motivational reward at the end of that workday.

I have been 3 times in the last 2 months after hearing about its existence.  Everything there is beautiful.  Everything you eat and drink is beautiful.  And delicious.  I have yet to order something I did not enjoy.  And it's only slightly more money than Starbucks but you get handcrafted, tasty and beautiful for that extra money towards a local business.

Your first visit, someone in your party needs to order the beautiful rainbow aka the Birthday Cake latte.  If you're concerned about sweetness, ask for them to dial it down for you.  It will bring a smile to your face even after the darkest of days.  Also, there are so many options even if you don't drink coffee that still can be aesthetically pleasing. 

Then grab a toast of your choosing.  Let's Avo Cuddle has been my favorite thus far of the avocado realm but I also appreciated the creativity with the Seoul Much Avo (I just wished there was a bit more heat) but the ABB's of Toast is excellent for a sweeter but still protein packed snack.

Take a moment to shove all your worries aside and enjoy!

And the employees are super friendly too, which never hurts.  Plus they encourage others to interact with one another with certain tables  at the front.
