Embrace this treasure in the Richmond district, they keep reminding me that they are the pot of gold at the end of the rainbow... while being the rainbow :0).
author: Lori D.

description:
The prettiest latte I've ever seen - birthday cake latte. They could also make it decaf; unfortunately skim milk was not available. 

Slightly on the sweeter side, so I was not able to finish it. Wish they could torn down the sweetness by half.

Other specialties include lavender latte, red velvet latte, Nutella latte. That piece of avocado toast also looked very attractive! 

Girls go nuts!
author: Elaine H.

description:
You may find yourself at Home due to the plethora of photogenic beverages they have (pro tip: the Birthday Cake Latte is the classic one with the rainbow leaf). But you'll be glad to know their drinks are TASTY too! You have the option to customize the sweetness of your drink so if you're not a big fan of sweet you can enjoy their menu. They also have really good toast with varying spreads (all of the avocado toasts are delicious!) which are equally as photogenic:)

Your drinks come so full that really the only thing holding them together and from spilling all over the place is the surface tension of the liquid. If you have shaky hands have a friend carry your drink or you can ask the staff to do it as well!

Speaking of the staff, they are so nice and take the time to explain anything and everything on the menu. I was just visiting from out of town but found myself wishing I had the $$$ to move next door so I could go to Home every morning!
author: Joan H.

description:
I can't speak highly enough of Home! I visited their Sunset location a few times in the past but without a car it's a bit of a pain to get to via Muni (I'm a public transport fiend!). That said, you can understand how excited I was to find out they opened a second shop in a more convenient location for those of us on the other side of Golden Gate Park. 

Home is off 22nd/Clement, an otherwise relatively quiet block on Clement. When you enter the shop, you'll notice a handful of stools to the left (seats about four people). There are multiple tables-for-two with a few reserved for non-laptop use (which I appreciate since not everyone is there to work or play with computers). There is a back room as well with larger tables though I've noticed there are usually study groups hanging out there. (So, obviously, they have wifi!)

The baristas are incredibly friendly and seem to enjoy each other's company (a good sign indicating a happy staff and an even happier work environment!). Oh! Also, their music is always on point: from '00s MTV "TRL" music (e.g. NSYNC, BSB) to '80s soft rock to '70s "solid gold" to '90s R&B, they are bumpin' all the nostalgic jams (THANK YOU). While I like their lavender latte and hazelnut latte, my go-to is their iced coconut vanilla latte. It's refreshing, satisfying, and not *too* sweet like some lattes I've had at other spots. I've not tried their food at this location, but having visited Home in the Sunset, I can say it's pretty good -- especially their fancy and filling toasts! 

Now, my only wish (and I'm almost certain I've said this about their Sunset location) is that they would stay open beyond 5 PM since my desires for caffeine and coffeeshop lounging extend well after dinner hour. Alas, I'm just happy they've opened this location! Home: please don't ever leave! Like, seriously.
author: James Z.

description:
Love this location! Very clean and spacious. 
Their selection is the same as the in Sunset. I like to come to this one because there are more places to sit. Yes it can get crowded with people, but I don't think it ever got to the point where I felt like I was fighting for a table. 
Some people were talking about "no laptop" sign, but that's only for the tables near the entrance. It's nice they have table for those who are coming to enjoy the drinks and food. It's a not spot for students and workers, but not all customers are coming in to study. 
Today I walked in with my mom to grab a cup of coffee and tea while the car was getting checked up. My favorite is the London fog. I've tried their lavender latte and it's pretty good! 
Parking is okay. There are meter parking around. I never had the issue where I couldn't find parking, but I can see how weekends might be hard. You can always come here by bussing or ubering. 
Love this location. I would come here to get their drinks and study with a friend!
author: Kiyomi K.

description:
Honey, I'm home! Oh, how I imagine all new employees introduce themselves during their interviews for the job. True to their name, though, Home is fantastic at making their customers feel like they're truly at home on Clement.

Sweet, rich drinks are the name of the game here. While most quasi-independent coffee places pride themselves on their roasts, the people here are promoting their unique takes on lattes. As a result, I knew I had to spring for the cookie butter latte, despite its $5.25 price tag. That was surprisingly not as sugary as I'd anticipated. The taste of blended cookie doesn't hit you full-force until the dregs of the cup, although its milkyness and thickness is present throughout. I also tasted my friend's rose latte, which seems to be off-menu but was confirmed by baristas to still be served here. It certainly is ultra sweet, with the flower taking precedence over the beans. I'd venture to say that it was even sweeter than my cookie butter latte. Both drinks came adorned with their namesakes: a smattering of Cookie Crisp cereal on mine and a sprinkle of dried rose petals for hers. 

Her boyfriend first went for a lavender latte (again with the dried flower buds), then got a hazelnut latte with an extra shot for the road. We thought to ask for latte art on the to-go, since we'd all gotten similar tulips on our drinks. Lo and behold, the one we'd requested art on had a teddy bear and laurel. If they're not busy, I highly recommend asking just to see what other tricks they have up their sleeves. 

Some of their tables have a laptop ban, but fret not, workaholics. There are plenty of marble tabletops that allow for both solo and communal working. The bathroom is also easily accessible and clean. I'm hopeful they'll open one closer to Daly City or a BART station someday, but having this new one in the Richmond District is fine by me.
author: Gwen W.

description: Staff is super friendly, parking was hard to find. Drinks are reasonably priced. Got the toast with cereal on it and felt like I could have gone without it or should have gone with a different flavor. The birthday cake latte was made beautifully and does NOT taste like Birthday cake. Definitely good but it was alittle too hyped up for me.
author: Michelle P.

description:
Have been there multiple times. Their late arts are so amazing and tempting. Also, almond butter and banana toast is delicious  
I have also tried their hazelnut latte and it is so good!
author: Megha S.

description:
I love this place. They offer fun lattes (hello, Birthday Cake and Cookie Monster lattes) and regular cappuccinos, pour over, drip, etc. They serve a small but delicious menu of toast (like 1-2 inch thick toast) and pastries. 

The atmosphere is deeeelights. The playlist is a wonderful assortment of 90s beats, it's low enough where you can have a conversation without having to shout across the table. There is a nice open section in the back and looks like they may have an outoodr patio at some point in the future, but not now.

Plus there's free WiFi so what's not to love??
author: Ashley P.

description:
This place is EVERYTHING
I had the most beautiful rose latte. Delicious delicious. (Coming from a coffee snob)
Literally worth the wait. 
Great customer service, and even greater coffee.
author: Sydney B.

description: They make beautiful lattes here- if you're looking for something to instagram, this is the place to go! However, I've definitely had better coffee so if you're a coffee snob looking for some good espresso or a rich latte, this isn't the place for you.
author: Rosy L.

description: This place is definitely a fad place.  Their coffees are all great for the [insta]gram because they are absolutely gorgeous.  Flavor wise, I don't think their coffees are any different from any other place.  The birthday cake latte, which is the pretty rainbow one everyone posts on social media, pretty much just tastes like a vanilla latte from coffee bean.  There wasn't a lot of space either, so I wouldn't recommend trying it as a study spot.
author: Nishtha P.

description:
I was spending a few days in San Francisco but still felt like I needed to squeeze in some GRE study time! I went straight to the wonderful yelp community to look for a good coffee spot for studying and I found Home! 

I'm not one for sweet lattes so unfortunately I didn't get the amazing instagramable Birthday Cake latte. Instead, I ordered my go-to cortado ($4.07) and it was great! The espresso shined through the steamed milk and the aftertaste was so smooth and not bitter at all. Home also offers a wide range of other beverages like iced teas, hot chocolate and even orange juice, so if coffee isn't your thing you'll still find something to enjoy! Their avocado toast also seems to be decently priced (ranges from $6-$7.75). I was not hungry enough to order a toast but based on the quality of their drinks, I'm certain the toasts are amazing too. 

The coffee shop itself is quite large, with a lot of tables but unfortunately it was very crowded on the day I went. I managed to find a spot at one of the bar tops and it was fine for a short study session. There seem to be quite a few outlets so I'd say, if you find a table, this place would be great for a long study/work session! They also have free WiFi! 

What really stood out to me was the friendly service. I mentioned to the cashier that I'm not one for sweet drinks and he seemed so excited to make my cortado! I also told him I was from out of town and he so warmly welcomed me to the establishment and thanked me for trying the shop out. 

Overall, I really enjoyed the aesthetic and energy of this coffee shop! I will definitely make this a go-to whenever I come visit San Francisco!
author: Coleen J.

description: Suppppperrrr cute place. Yes, it's a thirst trap...but the latte I got was actually so good. The girl who took my order was so nice and clarified a bunch of things to me since it was my first time. I sat outside on that mini bench. It was a good time. I wish I tried out more. The birthday cake isn't supposed to taste like birthday cake! It was so well made tho. They can even make it less sweet for you. Also saw the cute pomsky (?) doing work with her pet parent
author: Macy Y.

description:
Can we just talk about how cute their items are? I had their avo sampler, which was AMAZING. You will die over how cute the names are, how delicious the avo toasts are, and how you get to try a little of each kind. Highly recommend for avo toast lovers like me!

I had the cookie monster latte, which I thought was super cute but tasted okay. I'll definitely be back for the avo toasts though!
author: Cynthia H.

description: My favorite neighborhood's coffee shop. Delicious coffee, awesome presentation and cool ppl work here. Wife and I come here Every  now and then for a cup of smth tasty.
author: Oleg K.

description:
The pretty lattes brought me here but the wonderful service and delicious lattes will have me coming back! I am not a local but I will definitely be making a stop here when I come to the city. 

The coffee shop is in the Richmond neighborhood with plenty of street parking. As you approach the shop a cute little sign greets you with the promise of love in your food. The decor is very minimalist but warm. The menu is a little overwhelming and I really appreciate how friendly and helpful the girl in the front  cashier was. I really couldn't decide between 3 lattes, once I mentioned I wanted the rainbow latte art she told me it was only available with the Birthday Latte which sealed my choice. 

There was a bit of wait for my latte but the barista sincerely apologized which seriously with the love in that latte it's worth the wait! I would have orders from their variety of toast but I had had a big lunch and was only looking for a pick me upper and boy did that cup of rainbow and delicious caffeine hit the spot!
author: Nubia B.

description:
Tried the Birthday Cake latte (w/ almond milk) and it tasted as good as it looks! Of the toasts I tried so far, the one that had chicken was a bit on the saltier side - they should bring that down a couple notches. The toast with the pesto and tomatoes was good though! 

Seating is shared, especially if it's busy, but all the patrons are friendly. If I drink anymore, I may just poop rainbows...
author: Leo L.

description: Possibly the nicest coffee shop workers I have ever met! I tried the rainbow birthday cake late (of course), and it was surprisingly delicious! I ordered it less sweet, and it still had a nice flavor. My friends also tried the cookie latte and lavender latte, both of which were delicious! Warning, the rainbow latte might stain your lips! This happened to the unfortunate gentleman sitting next to me, clearly on a first date  otherwise a nice experience and I'll be going back!
author: Alice L.

description:
It's almost my bday so it's okay to get the birthday cake latte early. 

Love this cute latte art place. 

Great staff.

Plenty of tables to sit. Like how they even have signs that say no laptop allowed. Buahahaha

Latte range from $5-$6. They also served small bites for breakfast. 

I hope you give this latte place a try. Cheers!
author: Owie N.

description: Visiting from Seattle--Came in today and had the best time here! Carolyn & crew were super friendly and welcoming. Thanks for making me feel special for my birthday! Such a good first impression of SF!
author: James D.

description: This place is SO cool! The drink designs sold me when I was looking for a good cafe. I tried the Cookie Monster latte and my friend had the birthday cake one. I took pics of it because it looked so cool. The only reason I would give this place 4 out of 5 stars is because of the seating. It took forever to get our drinks (the place was so busy so I understood why), but to find a seat was another story.
author: Cristina S.

description: We were headed to lunch and just happened to park right in front of Home. I've been wanting to visit Home after seeing pictures of the beautiful birthday cake latte (rainbow vanilla). So beautiful and colorful, and it was tasty. It's too bad I was full already, or I would've ordered the matcha love toast too. As for the interior, I love the marble tables and succulents placed at each table. This is their second location and I definitely want to visit their other location in the future.
author: Helen H.

description: I think the selling point of this cafe was the aesthetics of the latte drinks. I came here many times to see what they will serve up. Once I got a nicely decorated latte. The next 4 times I got very messy latte art. I think I'd rather go elsewhere to get a cheaper latte. The line gets long on weekends and its crowded and loud. Maybe on quieter weekdays it would he more enjoyable.
author: Nona T.

description: Birthday cake latte is a bit too sweet even when it's 10% sugar... perfect for pictures though. Love the Let's Avo-cuddle toast :)
author: Emilie G.

description: Birthday lattes! Red velvet lattes! Lavender lattes! And tea! Omg the most exciting place to get coffee in SF!
author: Desiree B.

description:
LOVED this place and my experience here!! **INSTA WORTHY**
+ aesthetic lattes and toast! Love the rainbow art soo photogenic and tasty too
+ i like the avocado toast sampler!! Very creative, one piece had kimchi on it
+ owned by a young couple that got engaged SO CUTE
+ the woman rang us up and the man made the drinks i think either way SO CUTE AND A+ service
She said hi and bye to everyone and addressed them by name

Love this original place and name and would highly recommend!!!
P.S. they have two diff locations and toast options vary!! The newer one is on clemente and other is on noriega just 5 min away
author: Mahima D.

description:
Went to Home for the first time today, and I can truly say I'll be coming back! 

It's not only aesthetically pleasing the moment you walk in, but the staff is friendly and don't mind answering questions for first-timers like me! I opted for the rainbow latte (which is delicious) and the BR-AVO toast (they do not skimp on the ingredients). My brother got the Hazelnut Latte and the ABB's of Toast. Did I mention it was delicious? 

Know that it's always packed, so if you see a free table consider yourself lucky! Easy options for eating in or take out, it's worth the drive; I know I've eyed a couple of items I'll be trying next time I'm in!
author: Ámbar B.

description: Super cool atmosphere, music and also staffs. They are friendly, fun and helpful. The art work that they put into a cup of coffee or latte is phenomenal as people can see on the photos. It's cozy here to sit and maybe do homework, catch up with a long time friend that you haven't seen in a while or even a Saturday morning breakfast and coffee with your significant other.
author: Karrie C.

description:
Love love love this place, my friends and I got practically every weekend and they staff is always so kind and attentive, and they do some wonderful latte art! My only complaint is that the frozen hot chocolate is just chocolate milk with whipped cream, which tasted good, just not what i expected. I also have yet to try their French toast, but don't come here expecting a full breakfast. 

Every coffee drink I've tried, hot or iced has been really good, you can ask the barista to adjust the sweetness level, which was helpful for someone like me who likes flavor without the overwhelming sweet taste. My favorite so far has been the coconut vanilla latte, I could drink that every day!
author: Taylor L.

description: SUPER CUTE HIDEOUT SPOT!! I absolutely love the trendy decor and the unique menu that features the famous birthday cake latte. I couldn't wait to indulgence in the sweet drink (which to my surprise wasn't overly sweet and was enjoyable)!!! I appreciated that they have plenty of tables that allow people to do their work in a nice environment. I went in when it was about to close but their staff still welcomed me in with open arms! Can't wait to come back and try new drinks/snacks!!!
author: Alina C.

description:
Glad I got to check out their other location! Parking is tricky with some metered spots out front of the store. If you drive into the city, I recommend finding parking on the residential streets. It may take awhile though :/ 

Home was not too busy on a Sunday afternoon and they have an extensive coffee menu with some snack items. They have the standard coffee menu like cold brews, lattes and such, but they also have a wide variety of their specialty coffees too! 

My friend tried the rose latte and I just ordered an regular latte. First thing I noticed was how big the cups were. Not sure if it was just me, but I definitely felt like the drink was larger than what I was typically used to. The rose latte wasn't too bad in my opinion, but my friend thought it was too sweet. The regular latte was just fine too. 

There is ample seating indoors and most people seem to ignore the signs on the table that say no laptops. I don't think they enforce that rule here anyways. The wifi network is good and the password is "welcomehome".  Although I didn't try their Instagram worthy drinks, I think this place is still worth a try. Prices aren't too outrageous compared to other third wave coffee brands.To wrap up my review, I'd definitely visit home again and I recommend yelpers to go as well!
author: Kenneth L.

description:
I've visited Home a few times now since their opening one year ago. (Congratulations by the way! Coincidentally visited on that day!) It's a great spot to go with friends, on a date, for the Insta, or simply to get some work done - all while drinking and eating high quality cafe fare. 

I highly recommend an almond milk matcha latte. A close second is an almond milk chai latte. Add extra cinnamon to both! Absolutely delicious. Their matcha is definitely quality. (I have yet to ask what they use). I've been eyeing their toasts however I am dairy-free and the bread is not. They use brioche buns. There are no vegan options here either which is a bit of a bummer. For the full experience I suggest sitting down the first time you visit. 

There are signs that say no laptops however I've been able to work peacefully on my laptop with a coworker on a couple of occasions in the back away from the bustle of customers coming in and out. I hope they open the patio soon! There is so much room for growth still. Can't wait to see what else this establishment brings because the Outer Richmond is in need of more places like this. *A little pricy for those ballin' on a budget.
author: Shannon M.

description: Spending a week in San Fran and having a breakfast date with my gf here every morning!
author: Humberto S.

description:
A cute café that brings people in because of their beautifully designed drinks and interior. Not only does it looks good; the coffee tastes great!! My hazelnut latte is the perfect pick-me-up for the day. I also enjoyed the Godzilla but I only recommend it to those who enjoy the deep, bitter taste of matcha. It has an interesting taste and I find the combination of matcha and sparkling water so creative! 
Avocado toasts were yummy. The price is quite steep but give the kimchi one a go!! It's worth a try! 
+Friendly staff
+Clean and spacious interior
This is the perfect place to bring a friend and enjoy a cup of coffee!!
author: Halina H.

description:
This place was seriously so cute. The inside was inviting, the atmosphere was nice. The only thing is, waiting for a table to free up was pretty difficult. But besides that, the drinks were amazing and super adorable. 

I had the birthday cake latte and was it strong. It was slightly sweet, when I imagined it to be something for sugar addicts.  don't let the outside fool you, it's a latte after all.
author: Kayla V.

description: Cute cozy coffee spot with wifi which is perfect for those looking to get work done in a quiet spot. They have a selection of avo toast on brioche. I got the kim chi avo toast which was delicious. I loved the flavors of the avo and pickled kimchi on the fluffy brioche bread. Also got a matcha latte which was delicious and you could tell it was high quality matcha. However, minus one star because I actually thought this place was really over priced. My avo toast and latte outrageously came out to $17.
author: Lindsey E.

description:
I love the Home cafe on Noriega, so I was super excited when I saw that they opened one closer to my house. They have the classics (ice coffee, americano, etc.) along with their creative lattes. My favorite is the lavender latte, which you can get hot/iced. I prefer iced, so I can drink it with a straw and avoid swallowing the lavender petals they sprinkle on top! 

The staff is super friendly and offers the best customer service. The cashier (I think her name is Annie) rearranges tables and chairs to accommodate customers. They have a good amount of seating and fast wifi (+100 points). I think I found my new go-to. Will be back to try their toasts and get some work done!
author: Nancy C.

description: This place is so good! I went in after seeing pictures on Instagram of the pretty latte art, and I was thoroughly impressed! The customer service was amazing; the girl at the front counter offered us suggestions and was very kind! It's a great atmosphere for students and families. I got the birthday cake latte 1/4 sweet and it was the perfect amount of sweetness for me. The quality of the coffee was one of the best I've had. And the art was absolutely amazing! I will definitely be back next time I'm in SF!
author: Audrey C.

description: Super friendly service, well done latte art.
author: Eunice W.

description:
Highlights
- Hands down, they make the prettiest and most instagram worthy lattes. Looking for something sweet and a work of art, try their birthday cake latte.
- I'm not a fan of the overly sweet coffee drinks, so the nice employee mentioned they can customize to make it less sweet. I definitely recommend going that route if you are in for the birthday cake latte. 
- Lavender latte was on point as well. Looking forward to trying more flavors as I venture back
- Love that they have plenty of space and various seating options, pending outdoor area too when I visited a while back when they first opened. 

Improvements
- Not a place to camp out nor do I think that's the purpose as they have signs specifying on tables. Wish they had more seats though, since there is so much space in the back room. 
- Avocado toast was quite expensive and average at most. 

Tips
- Plenty of metered or residential parking nearby
- Lines weren't too long each time I came, but seating is not good for large parties.
author: Tracy T.

description: Beautiful coffees with a lot of attention to detail. Pretty good selection of breakfast items as well. Tip * have your camera ready!
author: Sandy G.

description:
Great place to get some Instagram sessions. 
The Happy Birthday Latte was okay taste wise. 
The presentation with the sprinkles and colorful art on top, coupled with the gold spoon and marble top tables are a nice touch. 

Did not dig the Strawberry, Macha, condensed milk toast. But it looked too cutey!

Staff was very nice and smiled a lot. Most looked like they enjoyed being there. 

I liked the positive social re-enforcements with the signs indicating no laptop tables with the encouragement to talk to each other. 

The metal cups were nice. And the bench against the wall gave good opportunities for photo backdrops. 

Street parking is ample for a Saturday in May. 

Wife wants to go back to try other pastries like the cereal toast and the cheese, corn toast. 

Go for photos, food okay.
author: Chris A.

description:
They have a lovely selection of drinks and pastries I went with the salted caramel latte which was delicious and a match muffin. The staff was very kind at the register and gave me the WiFi password. Very nice clean space, does get a bit crowded so get there early if you come with a friend. They serve espresso drink with counter culture coffee.
There's a good amount of meter parking around that area and I believe a parking lot close by. 

Overall it's a good place for some coffee although I wouldn't say the espresso is 10/10. Still would recommend if you like flavored drinks as they have a good selection of those, unlike most coffee shops.
author: Claudia A.

description:
Came here for the IG pic and the latte didn't disappoint either.

Service here is really friendly and the menu is fairly straightforward. I ordered a latte and expected some cutesy latte art, but got the standard floral design instead :(

They definitely need more seating, especially since there's a ton of unused space in the back. It was a bit difficult to find a place to enjoy my coffee without standing around waiting for an empty table/counter space.
author: Shirley H.

description: Cutest coffee shop ever! Everything is so cute from little succulents to little signs to the very best customer service! Had an amazing time with my girls here in SF! Matcha Latte with soy is not too sweet and I love the toasts - all of them. The bill for 3 is $45 - so affordable!
author: Jenny N.

description:
Updating to 5 stars after trying their delicious and beautifully designed art lattes! I usually go for the normal latte and birthday cake. The birthday cake one is so colorful. During my last visits I've also gotten totoro art or a bear. It's always a fun surprise.

I've brought out of town visitors here a few times and they are always impressed. It's a great spot to visit if you're in the area.
author: Sophia H.

description: Coffee was great. Atmosphere cool and modern very aesthetic. Cute. Good place to stop by and grab coffee. They had some good looking food that we didn't get to try. Me and my sister got the birthday cake latte which was amazing.
author: Kate P.

description: Cannot go wrong with coffee, got birthday cake latte on my birthday tasted a little on the sweeter side but good
author: Yana G.

description:
Hands down my favorite cafe in the city!

I've always loved going to their sunset location, but takes a while to get to by public transportation from my house, so imagine my excitement when I found out they were opening a second location! It's so much more convenient for me to get to! 

I saw pictures of their new menu items all over social media so I was determined to go as soon as I could! I wanted to try their Rose Latte, which I saw on Instagram, but it wasn't on the menu. Turns out they were still working on it and it wasn't gonna be on the menu for another 2-3 weeks, but they offered to let me try it! :)

ROSE LATTE - 4/5
I loved it, the only thing I would say is that I'd like the rose flavor to be a little stronger and it'd be perfect. The presentation is so pretty too!

AVO TOAST SAMPLER - 3 different flavors - 5/5
- Kimchee
- Bacon
- Arugula, tomatoes, red pepper flakes
GET THIS. YOU WON'T REGRET IT! 
It's literally the BEST toast I've had in my entire life! The first thing I did was take a bite out of each of them, and with every bite, I was more and more mind blown! I couldn't decide which one was my favorite - they're all equally amazing! Whoever makes their toasts is genius. Worth every penny and more. 

SERVICE - 5/5
The staff at Home is some of the sweetest people you'll come across! 

AMBIANCE - 5/5
This location is a lot brighter, with their signature decor - clean, simple, and modern. Lots of tables and outlets - perfect for studying/working and hanging out with friends.
author: Debbie M.

description: I love this place! It really does feel like home. They make you feel so special here. Free WiFi and outlets. It's a wonderful place to sit and work or read. Their lattes are beautiful and they always have interesting flavors to try. I've tried their lavender, birthday cake and regular lattes. They're all great. Highly recommend checking this place out! Do beware of the price though. Their flavored lattes are almost 7$ if I remember correctly. Really expensive drinks but delicious and beautiful! On a special occasion, it's great.
author: Lisa O.

description:
Great place to grab some coffee and get some work done.  Their cold brew coffee is pretty solid, fairly priced, and gets the job done!  They also have a lot of cool looking, crazier drinks like the lavender or rainbow latte if you're into that.  They have a lot of seating available, so you can hang out with your friends or finish all the work you've been putting off in the week.  Depending on when you go, it's not usually too noisy, so it's pretty easy to focus.  Just keep in mind that some tables are reserved for no laptops, but you're free to use your laptops at a majority of the tables.  

The baristas are always really friendly and the service is great!  They also have free wifi, which is always reliable and fast for me.  Home is definitely one of my favorite places to work in the city, and I would definitely recommend a stop here if you're in the area.
author: Tim L.

description: Really yummy lattes:) Not too sweet. The cookie monster one didn't quite taste like cookie butter (what it was advertised as), but was still very enjoyable. Would definitely like to come back and try more flavors.
author: Natashia S.

description: Loved, loved, loved, this place - I mean there's no place like home, am I right? *ba dum tiss* anyway I like the rest of the tourists in SF ordered the prettiest latte being that of the birthday cake along with avocado toast, cutely named let's avo-cuddle (bonus points for creativity). The cashier was so sweet and warned us about the latte saying that some may find it too sweet so if we wanted we could go half way on the sweetness. I was born a sweet tooth so I ordered it standard. My friend isn't big on sweet so she went half way. We both agreed that it was bomb and the avocado toast was delicious! I wish they'd open up a Home OC!
author: Widad D.

description:
Very warm and hipster place in Richmond District and come 10am the line is already long (6 people were in front).

The coffee and food is good. service is excellent .

their no laptop policy is for sure get them over the top.
author: Wai C.

description:
Just wrote a review for the Home on Noriega and figured, I'm on a roll... might as well write one for the Clement location too. 

I love this location! It's walking distance from my parent's house, which means once I've run out of productivity, I walk myself home for lunch or dinner. Haha. This really is a great location with it being on a nice, quiet street. It's less packed than the Noriega location (for now) so it's much easier grabbing a table, except for Monday mornings... but no big deal. The quality of their drinks here is the same as Noriega; I appreciate the consistency! My go-to drink at Home is cafe au lait. Occasionally, I'll have the matcha or chai latte. I felt adventurous today and tried the red velvet latte. I don't know what they use to make it, but it was so good! I like that it's not too sweet. The lattes come in this giant bowl-like cup. As I drank my latte today, I laughed and myself and thought, "it's like I'm drinking soup!" Haha

One thing this location has that the Noriega location doesn't is the back patio. There's no furniture out there, but it's a great place to have a quiet phone call when it's too loud inside or to let your kids run around freely. I've seen quite a few babies and puppies enjoy that outside space. 

Like the Noriega location, the baristas here are very friendly and welcoming. They really try to get to know the customer. 

I thought I'd explore more coffee shops since I moved back to SF. But quite honestly, Home was the 2nd coffee shop I tried and both locations have kept me from going anywhere else! Home is def where the heart is... and where my money goes haha
author: Angie Y.

description:
I've been wanting to come here for quite some time to try the pretty rainbow, birthday cake latte! Finally got a chance to visit one of their locations and catch up with old friends this weekend. We arrived around 2pm on a busy Saturday afternoon and were unable to find an open table. The cashier noticed we were waiting around and told us to check the back room, but those were occupied as well. We decided to walk around Geary and after 10 minutes or so, we were able to find a table near the entrance. (Also, the marble tables with the succulents are really nice and aesthetically appealing.) 

I ordered the birthday cake latte and my friend got the cookie monster latte. Both were beautifully made, as pictured. I was afraid the birthday cake latte would be too sweet, but it turned out great & suited my taste. Although the cookie monster latte had plain chocolate chip cereal, the design was really cute. Overall, aside from the seating issue, I had a pleasant visit at Home Cafe and the workers are really friendly! Would love to be back when in the area!
author: Joanne H.

description:
NEW HOME, WHO DIS?

Heh Noriega's cafe comes to the Richmond district and this space is bigger and brighter! Love the open kitchen and the marbled tables. The drink menu remains the same. There are more single tables for studying and a back patio still in the works. Metered parking outside or free street parking if you're willing to walk 1-2 blocks. It's a little far for me to trek out to for studying but I'm so glad to support this business that makes delicious drinks and has great customer service!
author: Wendy L.

description: Went to grab some coffee and a quick bite.  Got the lavender latte and the egg in a basket.  Both were absolutely delicious--the latte had just the right amount of lavender flavor and the egg in a basket was buttery, crispy, and nicely seasoned.  This place might have been designed with Instagram in mind, which isn't inherently a bad thing.  Home executes it perfectly--delivering drinks & food that don't just look good; they taste good.
author: Brian S.

description:
I love the ambiance of this place, and the staff are very friendly. I personally got the Hazelnut Latte and it was good but comparable to a lot of places that i've tried. It gets pretty busy so if you're coming to study it's hard to find a table. The drinks came out decently quickly. 

Overall, I'd definitely come back to try out some other drinks as well as some snacks. The vibe of this place alone makes me want to come back! Must try if you're visiting San Francisco or just in the area!
author: Roger C.

description: Not a coffee drinker, but gave this place a shot with friends since the photos they showed me looked cool.  The birthday cake latte was really good.  All the designs for the drinks were different. I really liked the vibe because it was extremely laid back.
author: Bradley S.

description:
This place is adorable. 
The food is good
The vibrancy is awesome.
But it's always packed and not enough tables. There is a back room that only has three tables... they should put in some more tables
Overall loved my experience.
Coming here again!

I got the lavender latte and my friends got the birthday cake latte
The Bday cake latte is very sweet.
And the lavender latte is mild sweet.
author: Lydia B.

description:
This place turns the casual drinking of coffee into art - see for yourself! The birthday cake latte is a classic, but they have one barista who literally PAINTS on lattes and creates any drawings and design you can think of! I asked for the poppies on my drink, but you can ask for anything you want yourself! :)

The tables are also shared. It's so interesting how they are encouraging participatory culture and communication between strangers at a table, over a cuppa coffee!
author: Marina C.

description: I'm new to the area and come in for a latte and some toast and was so surprised by how incredibly sweet the employees are here. Not just the usual "how are you today" sort of thing but genuine people who make eye contact and have real conversations. I was blown away. On top of all that the latte was amazing and so was the toast. One of my favorite places in SF so far. Thank you Christine for your kind words!
author: Madison D.

description:
First impression- it has a lot of space. There are plenty of seats for everyone and it's a great place to study, grab coffee, and some toast. This came to me as a surprise because SF is so small and their cafes are usually small, but not this place.

We came on a Friday afternoon, which was almost fully packed with students. I recommend getting there a bit early to grab a table, otherwise you may wait a little bit to get a table for your liking.

We came here for their Instagram worthy lattes and toast. We ordered the Cookie Monster Latte and Birthday Cake Latte. If you are more on sweeter side, go with the Birthday Cake otherwise the Cookie Monster isn't sweet enough for my taste. Their toast looked amazing, but based on what everyone was ordering the avocado toasts are their best sellers.

Overall, I would definitely come back again to try the rest of their menu. They have many choices to choose from and they have a second location. Their service was great and very friendly, which made me feel like home.
author: Kevin L.

description:
Cookie Monster latte is my go to drink and Seoul much avo is my go to snack.  Consistently good whenever I order those two.  

One of these days I'll branch out and try other their other menu items...My sister tried another drink and loved it too, but it was too sweet for me.
author: Kara M.

description:
Home serves good coffee and toast, but everything else is mediocre (atmosphere, quality, service). Their drink selection is extensive and includes all the standard coffee drinks (americano, cappuccino, cold brew, etc.), several flavored latte options (lavender, hazelnut, red velvet, birthday cake, etc), teas, and matcha. Home gets an extra nod for serving matcha as it is not a widely served drink amongst coffee shops. Drink prices are a bit above average ($4-6). 

Quite appropriately, I visited Home with my family. We each ordered a drink and two toasts to share. We all agreed our drinks were delicious, and I was especially pleased with my matcha iced latte - the perfect balance of subtle sweetness and earthiness. I was a bit disappointed they do not serve low fat milk, but I do appreciate they have other options aside from whole milk, including almond and soy. The avocado toasts we ordered were good, but not special by any means. Note, the toast is a thick brioche toast, which makes for a good vehicle for all the toppings. For those of you familiar with "brick toast" - they also offer a similar option. They serve both savory and sweet toasts. 

Seating is communal, and this seems to be both a popular spot to study and hang out. Their back room could use a few more tables, as the space is not being utilized to the fullest. Their atmosphere would greatly improve by utilizing this space to accommodate their customers, and removing the awkward boxes in the same space. Service is OK. 

Needless to say, home is where you make it...and I'm not sold this is it.
author: Jennifer H.

description: My friends and I LOVE Home! We come al.ost every weekend. Their special creations are super good and always fun--nothing your normal coffee shop will have. Typically, with a place like this, you assume they're popular just because their drinks look fun, but don't necessarily taste good. But I can assure you they taste as good as they look! My only complaint is that they are quite expensive, but then again, they put in a lot of effort so it's well deserved. Heads up though, their alternative milk prices are around $1 extra. I've tried several of their creations, and so far my favorites are the coconut vanilla latte and the rose latte. Their rainbow latte is pretty good- I recommend getting it once just to say you've got it-but the real winners lie in the less fancy drinks. They have minimal seating however, and parking is really hard to find around this street (so if you can take public transport I'd highly suggest it).
author: Rosalie H.

description: Came here and ordered the Cookie Monster drink. So delicious and cute!!! Actual Cookie Crisp in the drink made it all worth it, plus it tasted very good.
author: Allix H.

description:
I've been to the Noriega location a handful of times and after hearing about the new Clement location, I couldn't wait to visit. This location is fairly bigger than the first location, so that's extremely convenient for students that live near by. 

Drinks: 5/5!
So far I've tried the Chai tea latte, Lavender tea latte, Coconut vanilla latte and the cold brew. I usually get the chai and lavender as a hot drink on an normal San Francisco cloudy day as comfort. As for the coconut vanilla latte, I prefer having this drink iced! The coconut vanilla flavor is perfect for a warm day that's in need of a refreshing drink. The caffeine is a bit strong for my preference but it definitely helps if you need an extra kick in energy. 

Service: 5/5!
The staff here is so sweet. The last couple times I've been here, there's been a girl working named Judy that helps me at the register when I'm inching to try something new, whether it'd be a drink or a snack. One time, I came in with a few friends and one of them spilled a little bit of their drink over the cup, dripping down onto the plate. When one of the staff members noticed, she came over to our table and wiped down the cup. She also replaced the plate with a brand new plate. Everyone that works here is super generous, and for those that haven't visited Home yet, I highly recommend coming in for a quick drink to go or a small work session at one of the tables.
author: Tanya T.

description:
Get your camera out otherwise you may feel like you're all of a sudden a foreigner or like Marty McFly traveling through time. In this day in age it's hard to find a person who is not on their phones but in this establishment, you will NEVER talk to someone who isn't taking a photo.

The special lattes are definitely creative and tasty but if you're not a sugar fiend, then please skip those options. The pace is pretty but definitely caters to the optimal photo. Good luck!
author: Kevin J.

description:
I heard about Home opening a new location but wasn't be able to visit until today. We got here pretty early on a Sunday morning around 8:30AM. I wanted to take my friend here before she went back to Asia. 

This location offers more options on drinks and the toasts are different than the Outer Sunset location if I remember correctly. The place is huge compared to the Outer Sunset location but share the same aesthetic. Again, a lovely cafe where you can chill with friends to have a nice conversation, or read a book, you know, things like that.

My friend got Latte and I got Sea Salt Caramel Hot Chocolate. We shared ABB's Toast and Avo-Cuddle Toast. I don't have much to say about ABB because it's peanut butter with strawberry and banana on the top. However, Avo-Cuddle, oh wow, I love that small kick of the chili flakes after my first bite. It was definitely a surprise and I love the avocado smash pairing with toast and tomato. The only downside is that my tomato rolled out on my toast when I tried to take a bite... so I've lost 1 half cheery tomato... but that's okay... I guess... :(

Anyways, friendly and sweet staff, chill atmosphere and tasty food. Parking is pretty easy in the morning so I think I'd come back next time :)

2017032
author: Leslie C.

description: The cafe is quite small, but it has nice decorations and service. I expected the Birthday Latte to be rainbow-colored, but it turned out to be purple-pink (still looks great). Their drinks are aesthetically pleasing, but they taste okay. The Rose Latte has an artificial taste, so I prefer the Birthday Latte.
author: Renee W.

description:
Home is such a cute, cozy cafe that really almost feels like home. Hehe. If you're the type of person who "does it for the 'gram," of course you have to order the birthday cake latte. It's the most beautiful coffee I've ever seen. All their drinks are great and interesting (Coca cola & espresso, anyone?)

The people working here are really friendly and weren't giving me dirty looks for sitting here for a good 1-2 hours. I was there discussing wedding plans with the future mother in law and glad we were able to find this cafe. The atmosphere was just right -- not too loud nor quiet, and it had a calm ambiance.
author: Janet H.

description: How exciting! I haven't been this happy about a brunch spot since Europe. So delicious, trust me you won't be disappointed. Take it from a Native try this place out. The people that work there are super sweet too. Nutella latte and the cappuccino on point. My boyfriend and I also tried the avocado super yum. Abbs toast totally hit the spot. Puts yippee ass Heartbreaker to shame. Lol jk jk no shade. Just my opinion Home is better then Heartbreaker
author: Sasha M.

description:
I've heard some good things about this place so decided to check it out. 
First of all, the interior decoration is so nice and homey. I like the addition of no-technology tables that encourage people to have face-to-face conversations. 

I got the Godzilla sparkling matcha tea...very interesting and refreshing. The barista told me that it can be quite bitter for a lot of people and offered to make it with some drizzled brown sugar. So thoughtful! 

Both the cheesy corn and kimchi avocado toasts were good!
author: Ashley L.

description: I go to this place whenever I'm in the city. I always take visiting friends to try their drinks, birthday cake latte and cookie monsters are definitely tasty. I think they do a good job with the sweetness level as I can still taste coffee in there also. I appreciate that they have cute/aesthetic stuff but it also tastes really good. It's just hard to find seats sometime, lots of people study there. Please open one in the Peninsula!
author: S. S.

description: Love this place! Super friendly staff and quick service. Coffee was to die for and the toast is amazing. It's a must see!
author: Hannah H.

description: I ordered their birthday cake latte, while my friend ordered their bear latte. Hers ended up super cute, but my latte art was messed up. I was a bit disappointed. Their matcha strawberry toast was decent, but the toast was too thick and hard to be truly enjoyable. Otherwise, it's a pretty cute store. The location requires one to bus over (if you took BART into SF), but the transit directions are relatively straightforward. It was good, but more of a go once and not again type of place for me.
author: Audrey K.

description:
One of the best cafè places I've been to in SF. This place can accommodate a lot of people. Plenty of tables to sit around. 

They have a wide range of desserts and drinks on their menu. For a sweet tooth and coffee lover like me, this place is perfect. 

Their food/drink is worth taking pictures off, especially their Cookie Monster and Birthday Cake lattes. I like the vibe inside Home. It did make me feel I'm at 'home'. Workers are very friendly as well. Definitely coming back here.
author: Joseph B.

description:
I'd been wanting to go to Home for a while, and it did not disappoint. The entire experience was enjoyable, from the moment I walked in and was met by Home's great aesthetic look to the moment I sipped my Birthday Cake latte. 

I tried the avocado toast sampler - all great! And for "dessert" treated myself to the Birthday Cake Latte and Milk & Cereal toast - which brought me back in time to my childhood days. All around great food, great atmosphere. Will definitely be going back!
author: Catalina B.

description:
This cafe is poppin! The staff is really welcoming and good recommendations, also explaining how most of their drinks are medium sweet, and offering to change the level of sweetness if needed. I ordered the Cookie Monster lightly sweetened, and tried the matcha toast and avo-cuddle one. 

Our drinks and toasts came out pretty fast, definitely 10/10 on presentation. The coffee was not as strong but tasted really creamy and smooth. For the toasts, both are great - HOME is very generous in toppings, I was surprised by how many strawberry slices the matcha one had and the amount of avocado on the other. If I had to choose, I liked the avo-cuddle more. 

This cafe isn't too big and finding a table can be hard, I sat at the counter near the window, which was kind of a pain because of the strong sun. But it was worth and I would visit again if given the chance.
author: Sabrina L.

description:
I don't care what anyone else says about this place. 

I
Adore
It.

I've been here about four times now, and without fail, the service has been everything. I remember the first time I came, I accidentally said too loudly the prices were so expensive. I assure you though, the price is absolutely worth it. The baristas were super patient, suggesting which drinks they liked, and my goodness was it set to perfection. 

They even noticed my phone case which had Totoro on it, and they did not disappoint. 

I wish the place was bigger though. It gets crowded so fast, and it's such an adorable place to do your homework.
author: Hannah C.

description: So so cute. Love all their toasts. And you must get a birthday cake latte! So beautiful! And takes bomb! Very clean and friendly staff. You must check it out if you are ever in the city!
author: Caitlyn L.

description:
Discovered Home at their Noriega spot almost four yrs ago when I lived down the street. My only qualm about that spot was that as soon as they became "discovered", it was ALWAYS packed. And I love myself some Lavender Latte and some toast, but I'd been waiting for a new menu to pop up after four yrs of the same same. 

Lo and behold, heard about their clement street spot opening up earlier this yr! Exciting times. Bigger space. But my qualm here is that there's no parking :(...but that's really a Richmond District problem. Not a Home problem. 

Anywho, came by around 10am on a Friday to churn out some work while "working from home". Ordered my Lavender Latte and the avo-trio toast for breakfast. Saw the pics on Yelp beforehand - yum! I don't eat bacon, so initially I asked for the trio to be a double without the bacon radish one, but instead the cashier suggested I do the trio w no bacon instead. Glad I did bc it was super delish. All three pieces remained perfectly toasted w a perfectly savory avo topping (3-ways)! 

There are three tables in the front that ask patrons w laptops not to hog those spots, so I obliged. Headed towards the big shareable tables in the back and stayed there for the remainder of my visit. I'm pretty sure every worker at one point came by to check in on me, ask how I was doing, tell me I could get more coffee/snacks if needed, cleaned up around me, etc. 

It was such a pleasant experience to be there and be greeted by the entire, warm staff. Cheers and shout out to them! 5 stars :)
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Stopped by earlier this afternoon for a quick snack and a little pick-me-up. This place really delivered and exceeded expectation. Home is this cute and rather spacious coffee shop with some very instagram worthy items. But do they taste as good as they look? And the answer is... yes (at least for the stuff that I've tried). It was my first time here, and I had no idea what to get. The cashier, Mikaela (sorry if I spelled your name wrong) was really friendly and helped me figure out what to order. I'm big on the coffee classics, but I thought I'd try something different. Per her suggestion, I ended up with the lavender latte and the avo-cuddle toast. That was definitely the way to go. The lavender was nice and light, so the coffee still tasted like coffee. The avocado toast was fresh and flavorful. I like the little kick you get from the sprinkle of salt and chili flakes.

So the coffee was good, the food was good, but the service is what gives Home the 5-star rating. See, there was a tiny problem with my avocado toast, and I have to give them points for how they handled the situation. They were very gracious and apologetic, and made me a whole new one. They also brought over a complimentary matcha cake for the trouble. I usually don't like matcha anything, but this little tea cake was delightful. 

All in all, it was a very enjoyable experience - a testament to their wonderful service and quality treats. It's a cool place to hang out and kill time. Bonus: There's WiFi. See you guys next time!
author: Mica G.

description:
+ lots of seating (though we went on a Tuesday morning / afternoon)
+ unique, fun menu, e.g. Nutella latte, rainbow cake latte (pictured below) 
+ unique, yummy food menu, e.g. matcha honey toast! 
+ bathroom 

Cute coffee shop in the Richmond district, plenty of paid street parking outside. Mostly 2-people seating, window seating, plus another room in the back with a big table and another small table. Most people were sitting by themselves working on laptops, though they had cute little signs on the table saying "no laptops here, talk to your friends" or something along those lines, haha.

Very hipster feel but feels refreshing. The prices are reasonable for San Francisco. 

Tried their rainbow cake latte which tasted as good as it looked, though I was expecting a sugar explosion (It wasn't.) I'd recommend it even just for the photo opps. 

PS, check out the cute nursery across the road if you have time!
author: Jed Mariz N.

description: this place is very cute and the drinks are very pretty!! my birthday cake latte was ok but the nutella hot chocolate is amazing !! would come again :)
author: Jenna S.

description: I would come back for the coffee but the toast was bad. I came here with my friend. We ordered the avocado toast and another toast with bananas, apples and honey on top. I don't know if they gave us the stale bread because it was coarse and chewy. We couldn't even cut through the bread with the knife. This place was a disappointment. I would not come back again.
author: Victoria T.

description:
WELCOME HOME indeed. 

Not gonna lie, visited for the latte art masterpieces and to continue Operation "Aesthetic Coffee Shops of SF" (my first experience being the original Home Cafe). Home 2.0 is definitely an upgrade from the original: bigger space, larger menu, AVOCADO TOAST, and with all the original drinks that I loved from before. My favorite drink is still the Birthday Cake Latte, with the Cookie Monster Latte (the cookies are actually cookie crisp cereal!) coming in a close second, though I'm sure that if you just closed your eyes and pointed at the menu, you would still walk away with a delicious drink in your hands. My friend got the Br-AVO toast and loved it. 

Home Cafe (both locations) is the perfect place to catch up with friends in the afternoon, or just to get work done. Wifi is fast and it's just the right amount of noise. I love how this location has more seating than the original, with a back room with large marble tables. 

Also, shoutout to the super friendly cashier who let me know about the new Rose Latte. That'll be my next drink if I can convince myself to try something new next time I visit.
author: Justine H.

description: This place is freaking cute.  I came here to be basic and get a picture of the birthday cake latte and the milk and cereal toast.  Both were delicious and maybe a touch too sweet for my taste, but I'd still get them again.  You can alter the sweetness level of the latte, so if you're not crazy about too much sugar then you have that option.  There are plenty of seats to sit and study or chat.  Definitely check this place out!
author: Kim C.

description:
Excellent coffee!  I'm done!

Clean and good looking spot, large number of seats in front and back, quiet enough to work in.  Parking on the street, which at times/days I am sure is YOUGH!  Staff are friendly and on top of things.
author: Des D.

description: This coffee house is a fun place to start your day. They offer a wide range of original coffee and tea creations that have an artistic twist to them. The finger food toast are portable, pretty, and tasty. The milk and cereal toast is a must with a featured topping of Lucky Charms, strawberries, sprinkles, and condensed milk. Not as sweet as it may sound the flavors are well balanced.
author: Suzette A.

description: Unique, quality coffee, free wifi, great study space, bathroom, food, and some of the nicest baristas you will ever meet! Home makes you feel at home. I could sit here for hours (which I basically did!). They use De La Paz coffee beans (bought out from Four Barrel) and create the most unique drinks you will find in the city! I wanted to try to Rose latte because.. ROSE. It was not too sweet and had that hint of Rose you were expecting. I've had the birthday cake latte at the other Home location and wasn't that big of a fan. I am more of a classic cappuccino girl which I did eventually get during my hours of studying here. It was just as expected and delicious. You can count on me making my experience several more times as I'm home during my break from school.
author: Meagan C.

description:
Nice and interesting coffee! I love the latte design and very yummy avocado toast!

Ambience - 4 star
Very clean, and roomy! Tho not that many seats given the space so it gets crowded and can be difficult to get a seat. 
Lots of outlet under the bench so great to grab your laptop and do some work here!
It also gets a little loud here it!! 

Service - 5 star
Super nice staff!
Lots of staff working behind the counter so even when there is a long time, you get your order pretty quick!!

Food & drink - 5 star
Simple but creative menu with good variety which I really like.
Coffee is great! I got the birthday cake latte, and was kindly reminded that it tends to run on the sweet side so I have it light sweet and it turned out perfect and super fun to have those colorful latte art!
I also got the let's avo-cuddle toast, I love it! It's fresh and it has a bit of chili  flakes sprinkle over so it gets a bit of a kick in it but not spicy at all (to me)

Would definitely come back to try the other creative latte!!
author: Gwyneth C.

description:
First off their cashier was SO NICE
It made my experience so awesome. She took her time to explain what was on the toast I ordered and in my latte. 
I got the birthday latte and when I told her I wanted soy she asked if it was preference, I explained I'm lactose intolerant and she let me know it also had condensed milk TYSM FOR LETTING ME KNOW :') she seemed very caring and just very happy I loved it.
*really chill vibes, soft music was playing and I was able to get some reading done. Super dope coffee shop vibes. 
* their little tables with small cacti are so cute. Nothing to complain about 
*my latte was yummy and so was my ABB toast
author: Celeste F.

description:
Great place for delicious picture worthy lattes and to get some work done! I will definitely be a regular here.

What I ordered:
* Birthday cake latte

Overall thoughts: 
* Right off the bat the cashier was great at making conversation and making sure to let me know what was in the drink/ if I wanted to adjust the sweetness. She even noticed I had my backpack and asked if I was here to do work and wanted the wifi info
* The latte was presented beautifully and tasted great
* Seating is limited but comfortable with outlets! I do wish there was more seating because it seems like there is more space in a room past the front area..which brings me to my next point
* There are so many workers at once and in their down time they can be having a little too much fun talking and if I didn't have my ear phones on it might be hard to do work so I would prefer to snatch a seat closer to the back next time 
* Another con that they can't really control is after school hours there's a good amount of young high schoolers running around the place so I will most likely avoid those hours next time
author: Sarah W.

description: We stumbled across this place as we were trying to find some place to eat. Warm inviting atmosphere with awsome friendly baristas. My first time here and the experience was pleasant. Just had a regular classic drip coffee during my visit just to check out the place. Great studying environment, beautiful interior design with plenty of seating. Will definitly come visit again.
author: Len A.

description: I had been dying to try this coffee shop since a friend recommended it to me. I've been following Home SF on Instagram for a month and couldn't wait to try a specialty latte! Visiting from LA, I wanted to make sure I tried this place before returning home. My expectations weren't too high as I figured it would be a cute, hipster place with bitter, somewhat watered down coffee. Boy, was I wrong! I was surprised we didn't have to wait in line at all. Cashier and barista were very friendly and asked if it was our first time at Home and where we were visiting from. After asking for several recommendations, I decided on the Birthday Cake latte and my boyfriend chose the Cookie Monster latte. Both lattes came out in a timely fashion and were hot. So glad they were served in real mugs instead of paper like so many mainstream coffee shops nowadays. The latte art was unlike anything I'd ever seen before, and I was thoroughly impressed. Both lattes were surprisingly delicious and not too sweet. I could taste the coffee and there was a definite hint of vanilla in the birthday cake latte. Would highly recommend the already packaged OG graham crackers to dip in your coffee as they are not too sweet and add a great crunch to your afternoon cup of joe. We found a place to sit without having to wait, and I snapped a bunch of pics of my coffee to make my friends jealous. And it worked! Hands down, the best latte art I've ever seen and Home SF executed perfectly. I will be returning and would recommend to anyone who's looking for a cute AND delicious coffee shop!
author: Katie R.

description:
This recent discovery has been such a blessing! I've been looking for different coffee shops in the city that are also great for working on your laptop or simply reading a book & Home does not disappoint! The interior of this cute little establishment has great window lighting and sets the perfect ambiance for simply stopping by and getting your caffeine fix or staying for a longer time to get some work done (ask the workers for the wifi password). 

The service here is great too! The staff were so friendly and cordial upon greeting me when I was ordering. I ordered the lavender latte and was very impressed by the perfect ratio of sweetness; this drink definitely deserves the high praise that it gets. This place is a new favorite and I plan on coming back to try out more drinks & to see what other wonderful designs can be made from the latte art.
author: Grace Z.

description: As always, Home SF did not disappoint. We tried their rose latte and holy cow latte and had matcha love toast for breakfast. The toast had strawberries and matcha on top. Everything was aesthetic and delicious. I can't wait to go back and try the rest of their menu! I heard that their avocado toasts are to die for.
author: Charlene F.

description:
Very overhyped coffee shop. I've only been to the one on Noriega once, and I obviously didn't want Starbucks/Peet's on my day off. I ordered a holy cow and Cookie Monster both iced. Since I was making the stop here, I decided to double fist. I thought the Cookie Monster tasted better. The holy cow, although I love condensed milk, lacked flavor. Also, I couldn't tell if the espresso shots were expired or not in both of the drinks. The drinks came out pretty slow because there's essentially only one machine and only one barista making drinks. 

I will be back to try other drinks though. Home has some pretty creative ones. My only real complaint are for the iced flat lids. They don't go the cups smoothly and however which way I hold my drink, it pops off. My review is more like a 3.5 rather than 3.
author: Jeanne C.

description: The fact that they literally tell you "Welcome Home" upon ordering takes "Mi Casa, Su Casa" to a whole new level. If you ever dreamt of having your Birthday Cake inside of a cup of coffee, Home is here to make it happen! If you tell them it's your birthday, they'll even write your name underneath the badass rainbow swan they create. And if you're as obsessed with cereal as I am, be sure to order the Cookie Monster Latte- it will literally rock your world! Also, be sure to send someone in your crew over to save seats while everyone else orders- this place can go from 0 to 100 real quick!
author: Ryan M.

description:
Noise Level: Mellow Background Music, but can get noisy during busy hours
Ambience: Bright Natural Lighting 
Drinks: Mainly Coffee/Lattes/Tea with a few non-caffeinated options
Wifi: Yes
Seating: 12+ tables with mainly two people tables, seats approximately 30 people
Bathroom: Yes
Parking: Difficult in Richmond 
Overall: 8.5/10 for Studying and Working

I find myself coming back here all the time! It's a really good place to study and get some work done. The barista's are super friendly, making one of the best cold brew I have tried in SF.  All of their foods and drinks are made to be on Instagram! The only complaint I have is the awkward chair to table ratio, but maybe that is just me haha
author: Angela L.

description: My first visit to Home was at the Noriega location. I prefer this location's  ambiance , size of the place, and staff rather than the Noriega location. Plus, Noriega seems to have a smaller menu than this one. This location is the only one that has the instagram worthy Milk & Cereal Toast AND Avocado Toast Sampler. They even reposted my son on their IG :)
author: Sarina A.

description: Lavender and cookie monster latte with avo-cuddle toast made for a perfect late morning treat. It was crowded inside but we managed to find a nice little nook to sit and sip on our coffee.
author: Alexandria D.

description: Everything from the coffee decor to the wall decor to the everything decor is incredibly adorable; very aesthetically pleasing. The coffee quality is alright, but everything is sweet. Great study place with free wifi but some outlets are a tad difficult to get to. I just don't like how there's no handles on the mug... my drink was hot and I couldn't sip on it until the beverage was cooled down enough for me to hold the handle-less mug.
author: Daw M.

description:
I would have rated this place around 3 stars as a coffee shop but the cashier and servers were all so sweet, I was blown away. They all say "welcome home!!" when you enter and it's so enthusiastic in a rare way for an SF coffee shop. 

The drinks that are popular here are the aesthetically pleasing lattes everyone has seen on Instagram. The Birthday Cake Latte is the one with the rainbow latte art and sprinkles, really cute! I am not a fan of super sweet drinks so I got a lavender jasmine tea latte which was not anything special and for the price ($4+) I wish it came in a larger mug. My friend got the "Coke-tastic," aka espresso in a coke ice cream float. Interesting drink that tasted sweet but bitter; cool concept but neither of us loved it.
author: Hana S.

description:
This place is adorable! Good service! Cute, friendly staff! And the most interesting coffee concoctions! ENJOY 
I had the lavender latter which was perfection
author: sofia r.

description: Very friendly staff, great price for a great latte, and very clean & trendy environment!!
author: Sarah G.

description: Loved this place! Great environment and great people! Coffee is fantastic and the pretty designs are a plus too!
author: Ashleigh L.

description:
I love this place and the employees are the friendliest I've come across in the city! Cute place and pretty spacious but I wish there was more seating especially in the back. The lattes are beautiful. Next time I'll try the toast! 
Side note- alternative milk should not be extra
author: Isabel P.

description:
Avocado toast is the new craze. And Home executes well. 

They have some fun creative drinks. Clean atmosphere that wants to keep you there

I tried the br-avo and Seoul much avo both delicious. I also like their matcha latte as well especially since you can adjust the sweetness. 

Good addition to the neighborhood.
author: Lyman C.

description:
First time here! We didn't know what to get because there were so many good options. But the barista was really friendly and gave us the run down of the menu with recommendations of the most popular options and the most instagram friendly drinks.
Got the lavender latte with almond milk and the avocado toast sampler; both very delicious!
author: Christie T.

description:
Pretty signature lattes explained by super friendly staff. I opted for the birthday cake latte (which is not meant to actually taste like birthday cake FYI) and it did make for an aesthetic picture. 

They also have various toasts to crave your sweet tooth. Nothing remarkable, but definitely tasty and satisfies the craving. 

There is a decent amount of seating here for a cafe but they are frequently occupied by people getting work done.
author: Matthew L.

description:
I love this place! The ambiance, staff and coffee selections are all top notch. Come here for the inventive drinks, like the lavender and rose lattes (my favorites). This is not a place to just get a regular coffee, as they have so many different and unique drinks to try.  They all look like they were made for Instagram, and are a rarity in that they are actually just as good as they look. 

I've been here a few times since I work nearby, and was happy to see that recently they added gluten free mochi muffins to their baked goods offerings!!! The same muffins served by Boba Guys and Catahoula Coffee Co.  They are SO good. Plenty of light lunch/snack options, and tea for those who prefer that to coffee.
author: Kathryn P.

description: This place was an Instagram worthy location ! Ordered birthday cake and enjoyed the look of it. The coffee was just ok. Loved the ambience tho
author: Theresa Y.

description:
Wow! This was such a fantastic eating experience. Not only was this the most Instagram-able Coffee I've ever had but everything tasted delightful. The interior of the spaces modern and clean. I love the ambience because it was simple and fresh. When I went I got the birthday latte, which is basically a vanilla latte with hazelnut. Is latte was spectacular. It was decorated with rainbow colors and rainbow sprinkles. 

We also got the cookie latte which had a bear in the foam as well as cookies on top. This was delicious and sweet as well. I was most blown away by the matcha toast. I wasn't expecting that much from this, but it was the most delicious toast I've ever had. The matcha toast was made with bread, condensed milk, matcha, and strawberries. The strawberries even or shaped into a rose.

I strongly urge you to check this place out. It will amaze you and inspire you. It'll also be one of the most delicious coffee and snack experiences you'll ever have. I'm looking forward to my next trip to Home!
author: Zoe Z.

description: YUM. The birthday cake latte and avocado toast were to die for, my pictures were adorable, and it was a true millennial dream ;) Only issue was that it was packed (to be expected) but the only tables they had were tiny and seated like, 2 people, and there was tons of open space that could have been filled with more seating. We had to stand by the door and use a stool as a mini
author: Peggy A.

description:
Atmosphere was very cute and modern, a lot of space. It was less crowded here than the Home Cafe on Noriega. 

The Rose Latte and Matcha were okay. I preferred the Rose Latte over the Matcha.
author: Megan L.

description: Home cafe locates at the convenient part of Noriega and 19th Ave, where there is the constant muni #28 bus coming at the stop. The latte art is amazing, especially the birthday cafe latte for its popular colorful design. The place is packed, but finding a seat is still doable in the afternoon. The cafe is very clean and neat, and the atmosphere is suitable for chatting. We ordered the birthday cake latte and the Cookie Monster latte, and stayed for over a hour. The level of sweetness can be adjusted so let them know. The price for two drinks are roughly 10$, and definitely beats a Starbucks latte. The staffs are very friendly and helpful at phone calls and maintaining the shop cleanliness. Highly recommended for the coffee lovers out there.
author: Vincent Manjin L.

description: The drink and food menu is really unique and really delicious. I tried the chai latte and a savory scone. While the scone was a little dry, the latte was delicious. There are lots of tables in the front and back, though some don't allow laptops. Lines move fast and orders get made quickly.
author: Bianca H.

description: There are a lot of coffee shops that offer these different types of fancy lattes and coffees, but personally for me, I think this is one of the better ones because they offer a proper and satisfying quantity of coffee for the price. On top of that,  all of their lattes taste really good, especially their most popular one which is the lavender latte. I can totally understand why it's the most popular one.
author: Nishi S.

description: Instagrammable food is on point here and is equally delicious once you snag the perfect pic. I got the birthday cake latte and it has the most beautiful rainbow latte art with sprinkles. It is ALMOST too pretty to drink. They also had a ton of other creative lattes like red velvet and one with cookies. There are also simpler, more traditional options if you aren't looking for anything fancy. They also have a creative toast menu. I would have loved to try one if I hadn't already eaten. The barista taking orders was super friendly and made sure to explain drinks without even being prompted to ensure we knew what we were getting.
author: Elizabeth M.

description:
This is a nice cafe! Plenty of seating and tables, outlets, wi-fi, sunshine -- pretty ideal for a study or reading day. 

I'm kind of revolted by the proliferation of rainbow/unicorn foods so I did not try the rainbow latte...but the lavender jasmine tea latte was pretty tasty. They have all the lattes with a non-dairy milk option (almond or soy).
author: Susan L.

description:
Home can only be from 7-5, that's their hours.

menu: coffee, tea, hot chocolate, baked cookies, toasts, beverages.

long rolls of tables for laptoppers in a bright enivronment.

brew: drip coffee(2.75)
-bold dark roast, sippable or gulpable, depends on ur acidity tolerance.

eats: grahmn cookies (4/2.95)
-cinammon flavored, crunchy. made in an home kitchen. addictive.

cons: parkinging is terrible around here.

news on net: "The Hidden Bombshell in the Trump-Comey story " (truthout, 5/19)
-Trump bases all accessment on how news affects him. Comey goes negative on Clinton,
Trump euphoric, negative russian news: Comey: "You're FIred"!
Trump to Comey: "Comey should consider putting reporters in prison for publishing classified information".
author: Victor G.

description: Get the chai over ice and add a pump of vanilla! This place is super cute and the toast is delicious.
author: Natalia C.

description:
I've been here more than I should have in the few weeks they have been open. *So* thrilled to finally have a quality, homey cafe in my neighborhood. This location has the same innovative signature drinks as their Sunset location. Plenty of seating, good wifi, lots of outlets. The friendliest baristas. And the most amazing coffee. Hands down favorite cafe in SF :) A lot of other people seem to share the same opinion so beware of crowds on wknds.

I've tried the lavender latte (half sweet), hazelnut (half sweet) and cappuccino. All recommended.
author: Angela L.

description: Excellent spot to grab avocado toast, a coffee, or an IG pic. The marble countertops and scattered succulents make this location a popular one amongst hipsters. The lavender Jasmine tea latte was perfection. It was very light and had the perfect amount of lavender and jasmine tea flavor. The only downside to it was the small cup it came in. The tea bag is left in the cup as it continues to steep and takes up about half the volume of the cup. Sadly, a couple sips of the latte and you're done! The avocado sampler was a good choice to try. The kimchee avocado toast was very different from all the other toasts I've tried and my sister's favorite! Will definitely be back!
author: Amy T.

description:
This location is so much better than the one on sunset! But maybe because it isn't completely and utterly packed yet. Also parking is a bit easier! 

The space is a bit bigger with a lot of natural light! And the baristas are incredibly nice and charming!They may talk a tiny bit too much small talk which I might be upset about if I were in a rush and just wanted a quick cup of coffee. But this place has the best novelty lattes! Currently on the "secret menu", the rose latte with almond milk!
