With two shots of expresso and small rose petals sprinkled on top, it is actually delicious too I've grown since my days of super sweet Starbucks frappa and been drinking mostly a black cup of joe. But its not too sweet and they can adjust the sweetness of all their lattes a little albeit reducing the flavor. The rose flavor comes out very subtle and not at all overpowering. They will be releasing it formally on the menu next week! 

Definitely want to try their toast sampler next time. With lots of outlets and wifi (just ask the front for the password) it is the perfect place to crank out some work. Parking is mostly metered on Clement but there's plenty of residential parking if you're willing to walk a block or two. In love with this location and would come back again!
author: Kimberly Y.

description: This was the cutest little coffee shop ever!! The girl taking our order was so helpful and sweet. The coffee was great and the Abb's toast was AMAZING. I highly recommend if you ever stop in San Fran
author: Madison L.

description: I'm living the basic life eating a avocado on toast pretty delicious matt behind the counter was killing it. He heard he murdered the toast like no tomorrow and I ate it like no tomorrow I love this basic looking toast.
author: Alan S.

description:
Been back several times since they opened and the quality of drinks and feeling of being home has continued at each visit. 

On my latest trip, went on an early Sunday morning soon after opening. Even with plenty of people coming in and out, never felt crowded or rushed. Instead, I was able to leisurely drink my cookie butter latte, which was light and not too sweet (even aided by the mini cookies lining the side), and warm ham & cheese croissant which hit the spot. Everything tasted fabulous as usual!
author: Deb Y.

description: Came for the rainbow latte, of course and it did not disappoint. I was worried it would be too sweet just by the looks of it but it was great- a tasty vanilla latte. We also tried the "holy cow" recommended by the friendly cashier. He compared it to a Viet iced coffee and I would say it's a milder version of it! Cute place, easy parking even on a Saturday afternoon, and marble tables! What more can ya ask for?
author: Anh L.

description:
I am absolutely in love with this coffee shop. I wish we had this where I live at home in Charlotte, NC! The ambience is just so HOME-y (lolol) and I love the decor and the people. Their drinks are really light though, I got the Holy Cow and I wish the condensed milk was more distinct in flavor... it was so vague! 

They take coffee art to the next level and I really really appreciate that! My aunt said the pastry she had was really good, so give them a try. There is a huge menu so good luck!! Give one of the specialty drinks a go.
author: Jenni T.

description: This coffee shop has the most beautiful coffee art!!! I am a big fan of the Nutella latte it is delicious and not too sweet. However the Birthday Cake latte which is vanilla and hazelnut flavored the most photogenic, with swirling rainbow colors and sprinkles on top! I am amazed that the coffee here tastes as good as it looks! The staff here is very friendly and always go out of their way to greet everyone and make you feel right at Home!
author: Laura K.

description: They have the coolest lattes in the city! The birthday cake latte is the famous one but a little too sweet. Nonetheless, it's worth checking out!
author: Gabriela O.

description:
Home Cafe has always been my go to place to get my lattes! This location is so much bigger than the Sunset location and it has so much more natural lighting! The staff were really friendly and the service was very good as always. The interior design and tone of colors totally fits in with my aesthetics haha. Their excellent service reflects the quality of their lattes and toast. 

I tried their avocado toast: Let's Avo- Cuddle 
and it was very tasty! The bread was not too soggy from the avocado, and you can feel the texture of the toasty bread underneath the soft buttery texture of avocado with every bite! The arugula and the cherry tomatoes dressed in their vinaigrette/oil/balsamic vinegar (I don't know what exactly they used LOL) and salt and pepper added more depth to the flavors of the toast. None of the flavors over powdered each other and it was overall a pleasant meal. 

I got my Birthday latte - as usual - and it tasted the same as their other location & this time they gave me a bear design! Yay!!!! Im a sucker for cute latte art on my lattes haha!

My Bf got the Red Velvet latte since this location does not have the Matcha Latte like the other location. They drew a cute whale on his!

They have the cutest succulent for the best flat lay you can take - which I totally appreciate! 

Overall, I would go back to this location over the one on Sunset because of more table availability and the bright lighting in here. I still like the Sunset location but if I had to pick one, this location is the place to go! :)
author: Jessica H.

description: Really good coffee and nice costumer service! I would stop by again when I am in San Francisco! The lavender latte with almond milk was so tasty
author: Alena S.

description:
This new location is pretty freaking awesome. Bright Monday morning, early as can be but both Annie and InHo were so welcoming it felt as if I were indeed Home.

This new spot is much bigger than the Noriega spot, plenty of seating here, an outdoor patio (yet to be set up), a back room and I am sure they'll put some chairs in front too. The decor and feel of this place, you can tell they took the time to get everything just right. 

I ordered the Birthday Cake Latte this morning and it tasted great. Latte art was right on point and service was awesome. Excited to see what new creations they come up with at this location. 

Overall both Home SF locations are great. Owned and operated by great peeps. I'd go back to either spot no problem, little sunnier in the Richmond tho ;)
author: John M.

description:
Okay only one con. A bit inconvenient when reaching for the outlet because of the seating design BUT,

Pros pros pros
- Great customer service 
- Creative, delicious and fun drinks
- Wifi
- Outlets
- So many tables and chairs compared to other location
- Great place to work and study.
- Modern and clean interior design
- Big windows for wide outside viewing 

Looking forward in coming back! Thank you guys!!!
author: Karen J.

description:
Five stars for the overall customer service and latte! This was my first time in the HOME cafes and I gotta say, I'm really pleased! I was staring at the menu for the longest of time when one of the workers (ugh I have to start asking for their names b/c they are so friendly and helpful) greeted me and from there proceeded to give me a breakdown of which latte to get based on: what's IG-worthy or for flavor.

IG-worthy:
-Birthday Cake

Best in flavor:
-Coconut Vanilla 
-Lavender 
-Sea Salted Caramel 
-Nutella 

There's of course many more but overall she gave this short little list of recommendations! I'm definitely down to try all of 'em when I come back to SF!
author: Christie C.

description:
This is such a cute place! The name is appropriate, as you truly feel at home when you're here. Fav cafe in the city!!

The last time I was here, when I ordered, the barista asked for my name. I said, "Kimi," and she started to spell it "K-I-M-M-Y." Suddenly, another barista came to the counter and said, "Hey, Kimi and I know each other! She spells it K-I-M-I!!" This was only my 3rd time here, and each visit was spaced out with lots of time in between, yet she remembered me?? Home lives up to its name!!

What I've tried:
- Birthday cake latte: This is a rainbow vanilla latte. It doesn't really taste like birthday cake. The baristas make sure you know that before you make your final decision (they ask if you've ever had it, and if you say no, they proceed to explain what it actually is so you aren't disappointed upon tasting). THE PRESENTATION IS ABSOLUTELY BEAUTIFUL. If you have a foodstagram, this is one thing that you absolutely NEEEEEEED on there. Do it for the aesthetic. DO IT!! For a latte, it was pretty good. Nice and smooth
- Rose latte: I'm a sucker for anything rose. This was good, but I think the rose flavor could've been a little stronger. They top it with rose petals that you can eat. It's a nice touch!
- Godzilla: This is sparkling water with a shot of matcha. The barista warned me upon ordering, saying that it might be too bitter and that I might want some sweetener in it. My motto: The more bitter, the better. I really enjoyed this drink!! The matcha flavor was STRONG, and I love sparkling water, so I thought it was amazing. This might not be for everyone though
- Matcha love toast: Yummy!! They use organic matcha and condensed milk on this toast and top it off with strawberries. I think it was just a little too sweet for me...nonetheless, I enjoyed it

There are quite a few tables inside, as well as wifi and power outlets. The first time I came, you were allowed to use laptops at all the tables, but during my next visit, I saw that a few of the tables had saying saying no laptops allowed. It gets crowded as the day goes on, but if you come early enough, you'll be able to get a table. I also remember seeing a sign saying something about them working on getting a permit for outdoor seating

Bottom line: I ABSOLUTELY LOVE THIS PLACE!! I'll definitely be back. There's so much I want to try on the menu!! San Francisco does not disappoint when it comes to cutesy hipster coffee shops. DO IT FOR THE INSTA
author: Kithumini J.

description: Coffees are creative and tasty and the staff is so friendly! The space is nice to work in for a bit or just hang while you drink your coffee or eat. Really nice neighborhood spot!
author: Galina H.

description: I ordered the birthday cake latte which was really good and really sweet (I have a big sweet tooth so it was perfect). The girl that took my order was extremely friendly and welcoming! It seems like a popular and busy spot as it was a little hard to get a table but I would definitely come back!
author: Christina B.

description:
Went to Home earlier today because I had seen them on Yelp! 

When I came in the girl at the counter was super sweet and offered to explain the menu since it was my first time there. She made some great recommendations and explained what some of the drinks were like.

I ordered the Birthday Cake Latte and the Avo-cuddle Toast! Both were delicious and I would definitely come back to try some of the other drinks
author: Marcie R.

description: I finally was able to visit this place with my awesome sister and check it off my list of the amazing things that I want to try! We ended up getting the rose latte, birthday cake latte, and bravo toast! All of which were magnificent. The rose latte was perfect, it was sweet but not overpowering and tasted exactly of smelling a rose. It was also presented beautifully and i definitely recommend. The birthday cake latte was also very good and was absolutely stunning! It tasted of vanilla flavor and was truly amazing. Lastly, the bravo toast was really good and I loved the beets on top as it really added to the whole toast! I definitely recommend this place and it is definitely worth coming here. Both me and my sister thought that this was definitely worth the price and the long way coming!
author: Sasha M.

description: i love the side-by-side doors which both lead into & out of the same exact spot. yeah muhfuhs this is the land of excess. ppl say "waste not want not" but i think you should waste *and* want - waste your breath on the dankazz GODZILLA carbonated unsweet matcha and want more BR-AVO avocado bacon toast. bring your macbook n join the ~100 macbooks here at any given time.
author: Dan B.

description:
First time trying this cute little coffee shop and it was amazing! The girl that helped us was super nice and help us pick out the perfect drink for each on of us. I got the holy cow and holy cow was it delicious! My boyfriend got the mint chip iced
Latte and it was also delicious! Most definitely coming back!
author: Jenni M.

description: Hands down my favorite cafe in the city! Chai latte with almond milk less sweet is my personal go to favorite! Staff is always super friendly and the atmosphere is perfect for homework :)
author: Emily L.

description:
Home is pretty great. Fun and inviting atmosphere, emphasis on friendly service and pretty baller food. The Hangover (sparkling Americano) is amazing and I wish I could have it every day. 

I love the avocado toast but the avo to bacon ratio is kinda nutty. I think a slight price reduction or bacon addition would make this toast worth it.

Also, watching under dressed teens take pictures of and snapchat their food when you're trying to ditch your phone and enjoy a real-life breakfast with someone can be a little off-putting, so brace yourselves for that.
author: E E.

description:
After much Instagram hype over the rainbow and cookie butter latte I've heard so much about, I had to try this location out! I've been to their other location and tried the rainbow latte but it didn't really have the cake flavor I was hoping for. If any, it was mostly for the aesthetic. I liked the latte art and sprinkles they had on top but there was no flavor. However, I was willing to give the new location a chance. 

I'm glad this location is closer to my school. It was kinda hard to find because it was tucked behind a few other shops. The only thing that was recognizable from the outside was the sign that directed coffee-lovers and Instagram foodies from all around. Once I got inside, it was very crowded at around 3 pm on a weekday. It was spacious, with a bunch of tables lining the left side and the espresso bar on the right. There is also seating available in the back room. My friend and I had to wait for someone to leave to hunt for a table to sit at. There's just a bunch of people working on their laptops or students studying. 

The baristas were very welcoming and asked if my friend and I had any questions. There were a handful of specialty lattes and a bunch of toasts that I looked over, but I settled on the Cookie Monster, or their cookie butter latte. I've tried the one at Rise & Grind and it's my absolute favorite!! The baristas there always put a hefty amount of cookie butter, just the way I like it. I like my lattes to be flavorful, so I wanted to try both to see how the two compared. 

When I received my drink, it had a cute little teddy bear on it and came with a wooden spoon. However, the handle-less cup was smaller than I would have liked, especially for a drink so pricey ($5.25). The cookie butter latte comes adorned with some cookie crisp pieces. Much to my horror, the pieces were stale when I tried them. I tried a sip of the latte and it didn't really taste much like cookie butter- I also found out it was lukewarm! It just tasted like a latte with a hint of cookie butter, as if it was an afterthought. The cookie butter flavor was so subtle. I tried stirring it up in the hopes that there could be some more sitting at the bottom but it just was not as flavorful as I like! 

I was really looking forward this place, but it turned out very underwhelming. They make up for their lack in flavor with Instagram worthy latte art. Maybe I'll give this place another chance once they step up their cup design and flavor profiles.
author: Anne P.

description: Fun, busy cafe to enjoy some interesting and tasty lattes. from matcha, birthday, red velvet, cookie and much more. it can be hard to find seating, hang out and you might get lucky and scoop up an open seat.
author: Danielle H.

description: This place is great. They always serve consistently delicious coffee. Personally, I love cappuccinos and they have the best one around. I'd never tried a mochi muffin before I went to Home, and wow! Texture explosion!! I've bought roughly 47 coconut lattes from here, and even though they're on the expensive side I keep coming back.
author: Joe R.

description: I love the lavender latte - it isn't too sweet.  Every kind of toast that I have ordered has been delicious.  I come here every time I am in the area.  It is so clean, and the service is excellent.
author: Meagan K.

description:
I don't get why this place is a solid 5 star restaurant.  The coffee is ok but their toasts are amazing. I've tried the kimchi toast and arugula toast, both delicious and generous portions of avocado.

The coffee is ok, I haven't ventured to try their exotic flavors but I have tried their Nutella.  The coffee was not strong which is important for me personally

The service is top notch though, you get warm friendly service each time you visit. Also overall stoked to have a nice coffee shop open up in the neighborhood.
author: Samantha S.

description:
$3.25 for an ice tea and NO REFILLS.
Way overpriced on the iced tea and no refills is taking advantage of the customers.
Toast was fabulous but not giving refills on ice tea or coffee?  
Common.
author: Angela K.

description: I've now been to both locations and the Outer Sunset location is much smaller than the other in the Outer Richmond. Much more seating in the Outer Richmond as well. Such a huge selection of drinks and toast and other baked goodies. Diverse crowd and most were on their laptops hanging out.  There's metered parking out front and it took no time to find a space. We tried the Lavender Latte which had the perfect amount of lavender and sweetness and such a pretty presentation, also ordered the Birthday Cake which is essentially a Hazelnut Latte but the coolest part of that drink is how pretty they make it with the colorful design on top, IG dreams are made of these.... I also ordered the Say Cheese, a corny-cheesy-bacony toast. I wouldn't say I loved the saltiness of those ingredients and will be choosing a different selection the next time I go but it was okay.  Definitely try the toast with condensed milk, so yummy! The service was amazing, they were so friendly and super willing to answer questions. There was a bit of a line but things moved so quickly we didn't even notice. I'm definitely coming back to this location.
author: Dori D.

description: so many people think Asian culinary cuisine gets adventurous with Thai food. That is nonsense.  This little family restaurant just 3 blocks off Park Presidio is off the charts. the curries are delicious and the Hainan Chicken, a Malyasian delicacy, is incredible. But I got to tell you, the Roti bread is the best ever and of you are Vegan (I am not but I love some dishes), the Tofu with basil sauce is fantastic. Great service, low key atmosphere- this place is fantastic. One of my favorites.
author: Allan B.

description:
Had a plain latte, it was okay, and an avo toast, which was a good portion.


The barista said "here ya go buddy" which felt a little condescending and a strange way to end a customer interaction (I'm 28).  Nice place to have in the neighborhood.

A scratch on the head while calling me "buddy" would merit 5 stars.
author: Levi F.

description: Awesome place. Nice atmosphere. Got coffee and breakfast there and it was amazing. Must go dinky little place but nice and fast
author: Nancy X.

description:
I went to this cafe in Sunset and I was SO happy when I found out it was opening another unit in Richmond District. The Avocado toast sampler is an absolute must have. If you have any appreciate for latte art get the birthday cake latte or the Cookie Monster latte.

It's a mix group of people that go there but a lot of people go with laptops to do work or go along. Really nice spacious cafe! :)
author: Holly M.

description: This is a go-to if you're a coffee fanatic visiting San Fransisco. Also very Instagram worthy. All their coffees are made super cute, decent sized place & friendly staff.
author: Alina N.

description: Expensive but quality, unique and tasty lattes. The staff are friendly and provided great service. They're talented in their latte art too! One downside is that they only have whole milk - no skim/low-fat.
author: S C.

description:
Fun and fancy coffee and delicious avocado toast.
I get the Seoul Much toast with no kimchi:)
Staff is super sweet.
Thanks !
author: Rahna B.

description:
Gosh I'm in love with Holy Cow coffee and their Toasts all of them are delicious  my daughter brought me here, and now I am a number one client.
Cons: they just have one size cup to go and a little to price for that small cup :(
author: Carolina C.

description: Friendly staff, great and beautiful coffee! Love the matcha toast too! The parking outside is easy. I definitely recommend the birthday cake one!
author: Mika Z.

description: I love the coffee! I'm a big fan of rainbow colors! This is a very good place to relax and have a sip of coffee! Too bad I have to leave early because I went there with my little baby. I would return there again when I visit San Francisco.
author: Alice K.

description: Considering myself an avid coffee connoisseur, this was one of my top coffee shops of all time. I ordered the birthday cake latte. It wasn't too sweet as the cashier had described, and it had the perfect blend of coffee and cream. Best of all, the latte art was absolutely beautiful. Didn't get to try the other options, but the menu had plenty of variety!
author: Brittney K.

description: This was a really cute coffee shop! They have a fun-filled menu with yummy coffee drinks! The drinks weren't too sweet, they were just right!
author: Rachel Y.

description:
Delicious & beautiful drinks! Really hard to find parking; we had to circle the neighborhood for half an hour during lunch time. Tables were full, but seats opened up within minutes. I advise arriving before or after lunchtime.

They have an interesting concept of requiring designated tables to be electronic free. I came with the intent of working, but going to try out those tables next time!
author: Brittani C.

description: Cute lil cafe on clement. At first i didnt think i was in the right place because i associate these avenues on clement with all residential but nestled between( i think) 2 apartments is home. Inviting warm smile as soon as we enter. Limited toast menu since there is not offical kitchen. I of course had to try the birthday latte which came with a suuuper cute swan design. We tried the kimchee avo toast and the bacon avo toast both on brioche sloced bread super yum. Decor is sinple and clean. Im coming back to try the diff lattes for sure.  There are metered parking space around if u get lucky.
author: Melissa K.

description: I am so happy I finally got to try this cafe after hearing about it for months.  It has been on my to go places for a long time.  The location is in a very quiet area and kind of random.  When you order, they ask us if you've been there before and if you haven't they tell you, "Welcome home."  I thought that was so cute!  I ordered the birthday cake latte and the cereal (lucky charms + condensed milk toast).  Everything was perfect.  I like the idea of them not allowing laptops because it allows one to study without electronics and focus or have a nice conversation with a friend.  Although I wish they opened later, this is a wonderful cafe and I can't wait to come back!
author: Mikayla M.

description: This is my new favorite cafe in San Francisco! I'm almost disappointed I didn't discover it sooner! I came here for the first time on my birthday a few days ago, and ordered the Birthday Cake Latte. The barista I ordered from was kind enough to let me know that it was a little on the sweet side to make sure I would like it. Yes, it was very sweet, but it was beautiful and delicious! They were even thoughtful enough to write "Happy BDay" on it :). I had such a nice experience I came back the next day and tried the Lavender Latte. It was perfect! Thanks to the awesome staff and atmosphere of the place I will be back again and again.
author: Olivia L.

description:
Walking in here, you can't help but smile.  It's a beautiful open space flooded with natural light.  The hexagonal white tiling matches the marble table tops that line the side of the cafe.  Each table carries adorably small succulents as centerpieces.  I love the color palate of the cafe--a combination of white, black, light browns, and blues.  The cafe strikes an awesome balance of feeling modern and chic, but also very homey.

I frequent coffee shops around the city looking for different places to knock out some work.  Home cafe has many different outlets that line the walls and steady wifi.  I'm here on an early Friday morning and the place isn't packed so finding a table and waiting to order took zero time. I ordered the birthday cafe latte--super hype!  Just looking at the drink makes people feel giddy inside.  The taste is really delightful as well -- full, warm, with hints of vanilla -- damnit it feels like home!

On top of the homey feels, the chic look, the natural light, ideal work conditions, and tasteful drinks -- this guy up front rocking the man bun is easily one of the friendliest guys I've ever met.  This guy f**ks.  Smooth voice, great smile, he dropped the "welcome home" line and it was the cafe equivalent of the song drop from a Calvin Harris summer banger.  He noticed I had a laptop bag and without skipping a beat asked if I needed the wifi password.  Honestly, all the kind folk behind the counter seemed super friendly so huge plusses all around.

Looks good, feels good -- looking forward to coming back here regularly.
author: Max S.

description: I found this place from one of my friends Instagram. The birthday cake latte is sooooooo beautiful and the avocado toasts are very good, creamy and crispy.
author: Lei Z.

description: Love this place! Everyone who works here is super nice and friendly! They explained the drinks and asked us what type of milk and how sweet we wanted the drinks. We got there early before any lines and didn't have to wait long. The drinks were so pretty and tasted great! I would highly recommend coming here for a cup of coffee!
author: Mandy B.

description: To be honest, I don't really like to drink coffee but this coffee is amazing.. so fancy and tasty.. i love it..
author: Trinity C.

description: Super friendly staff! The girl who took my order, I believe her name was Cat was super nice and welcoming. She asked if it was my first time and let me know that the Birthday Cake drink was a combination vanilla and hazelnut flavor. It was delicious, along with my matcha love toast.
author: Ana V.

description:
Maybe I shouldn't give that many starts, so people won't come here :)) KIDDING!!!
It is not a big place so when I was there, it was pretty crowded. 

I don't drink coffee, but hubby does. He loved lavender latte I had very good Earl Grey (already plus in my book!). We had condensed milk toast and egg in a basket (I think that was the name). Both really good. 

The fair warning: I love condensed milk, I grew up with it (like all Russians, I guess). So for me it is extra special.
author: Nastia R.

description: I had family visiting from Florida and they requested to come here.   Glad they did because it was not on my radar.   The latte was delicious and pretty.   Customer service was excellent!    I will be back to try other drinks on thr
author: Tina R.

description: One of the best cafes I've been to! Definitely get the matcha strawberry toast so good and a lot of matcha!
author: Karen V.

description: The most Instagramable Coffee in SF and it's tasty to boot! Yummy toast delicious coffee  The Vanilla Coconut is a hidden gem but the most popular drink is the  Birthday cake and cookie monster latte! Fun and friendly this is a place you have to try!
author: Rokuda R.

description: Love this place and love that it's in my neighborhood and I always get great, friendly customer service along with some yummy toast and coffee, but lately there has been one major con to this place that's a bummer. Recently have been in and wanting to sit down with my avo toast and latte and relax and enjoy, but have had to change my order to go since all the tables are taken up by single person laptop table hogs that have long since finished their order. This includes the tables that say no laptops, so that's not working.  I get having a nice place to study and work with coffee is great and I've done it, but something needs to be worked out so it's not just hogged by inconsiderate laptop users. Maybe just the back room for laptops or encouraging others to share space or have a time limit? I would stop by more often if this weren't the case since everything else is awesome.
author: Alyssa M.

description:
Home is mostly a good surprise...and a less than pleasant surprise in other ways.

I ordered the specialty "Lavender Latte", and was delighted that the drink was light, frothy, and delicious to the last drop. (A tad too much sugar, but that's a matter of taste.) At $5.50, the price is little high; that said, the latte was as well-made as I've found locally. The staff was genuinely friendly, and service was prompt.  Another time, the regular latte was equally good, close in flavor to a flat white. I loved the foam designs on their lattes.

It can be hard to find a seat sometimes - a nice problem for a coffee spot to have. The real problem is the price: including gratuity, the coffee drinks are the most expensive I've found locally. A regular latte? $4.30. A lavender latte: about $5.50. (And the size is actually a little smaller than comparable coffee shops.)

The hard wooden seats don't lend themselves to comfort if you're sitting in one spot for too long. That's not a good problem for a coffee spot.
author: Thirsty C.

description: Forever my absolute favorite coffee shop. Best latte art, best tasting coffee, beautiful vibes in there. I just love it and have no complaints I drive from the southernmost part of San Jose just to come here sometimes.
author: Sara S.

description: I go out of my way after work, or during a bad day, and take the bus here. The drinks and service are fabulous. Tbh though I can't speak about the other drinks, bc I'm still attached to their chocolate mint latte (iced). It's the right amount of sweetness, with an awesome caffeine rush haha. Wish this place was open past 5, ugh.
author: Lucy T.

description: How cute is this place?! Yummy food, friendly staff, great aesthetics, and one of a kind lattes  will definitely be back and bringing friends!
author: Divina A.

description: The lattes on the Creative menu were delicious. Limited seating, but good environment.
author: Mathias C.

description: AMAZING. I love the birthday cake latte. The environment is nice and it's a nice place to chill and hang out with friends. I'm giving this place 4 stars because it is a little pricey, but it is way better quality than most coffee shops
author: Kyra L.

description: My boyfriend and I came here on our little San Francisco get away and I absolutely loved it! Their little saying was so cute the barista said "welcome home!" The coffee was great! Overall just a nice coffee shop for sure will be coming when we go up north!
author: Crystal V.

description: Can't say enough good things about this place! It was the best part of our trip to SF! Beautiful AND delicious coffee. Amazing toasts! And even better employees working there! So talented! This place is a MUST try
author: Jessica R.

description:
Recently opened, the Richmond branch of Home is gladly welcome in the Clement strip. 

The staff are warm and friendly and the food selection is delicious. Coffees are on point (rare in the area) and there are plenty of tables to work all day at (thanks to the free wifi).

Definitely making this one of my regulars, keep it up!
author: Oscar S.

description: Home cafe is a very cute coffee place. They don't let you bring in outside food. So they wouldn't let me eat my Mr Holmes treats. But there coffee is good but pretty over priced. The customer service is okay. Over all it's a nice place if you want some special coffee and good lighting. They also don't like it when people bring in the computers to study.
author: Isabella V.

description:
Perfect for a late breakfast

We were headed out to Golden Gate Park, looking for a late breakfast, and saw Home's listing. Fabulous teas, coffee, AND avocado toasts - sign us up! And we hoped that since we would be getting there after 10:00 the line wouldn't be too bad.

And it was just perfect for us. Great cold brew and cafe latte for me and my son. Fabulous chai latte for my wife. But the star of the car was the lavender tea latte my daughter ordered...and I ordered again for a 2nd round for all but myself (I kept that cold brew coming).

The avocado toast was scrumptious - the thick and chewy bread really made it. And a pair of very tasty black sesame and matcha muffins somehow leapt onto our table for a 2nd breakfast treat.
author: Leo M.

description: Just moved to the city.    I enjoyed this place a lot.   Not too loud.  The drinks are tasty.  I had a matcha.   Delicious.   I would like to return and try their a avocado toast.  ^^
author: William G.

description: Great coffee shop. Got the Cookie Monster latte which was splendid and the cereal toast. The toast was a bit messy because of the cereal on top but tasty nonetheless. Was able to nab a table for four easily but I think that was unlikely. Was not overly crowded at 10 on a Saturday but was busy as we were leaving.
author: Ryan H.

description: Got the Let's Avo-cuddle toast & infamous Birthday Cake Latte. Happy with my experience! I appreciate the sea salt on the avo toast. For the bday cake latte, you can ask for it to be on the less sweeter side. Such nice customer service too! & a back section for additional seating
author: Jen H.

description:
I was looking forward to this place, it was just down the street from my apartment. Honestly it wasn't that great. It was another coffeeshop selling $9 dollar avocado toast. 
I felt that my toast was lacking in taste, it had a very small amount of avocado on it with a whole bag of arugula and three cherry tomatoes. I had to take most of the arugula off because it was so bitter. 
I also ordered a cappuccino, it was ok. Nothing special, the best part of my drink was the design on top. While I got a leaf my friend got a cool looking bear. Out of everything that was the best part. 
I don't think I would return its just way over priced for what you get.
author: Veronica V.

description: Really cute place and the drinks and food are really cute too! I ordered the Cookie Monster, which is a cookie butter latte with Cookie Crisp cereal on the side. I thought it was ok, because I could barely taste the cookie butter in it. I also ordered some toast with almond butter, bananas and strawberries and that one was my favorite! Would come here again just to try more of their drinks and toasts!
author: Nicole S.

description:
second Home location now in the Richmond district! this location is gorgeous, relaxing, and spacious. ample seatings and with electrical outlets. they always play the best music at an audible level but not too loud for those who like to study here. 

I got the avocado toast samplers and all 3 were delicious that I can't decide which I liked the best. the 3 toasts sampler includes all their savory avocado toast. I didn't get the chance to try their 3 sweet toasts. I also tried their Godzilla (iced sparkling matcha tea). It is very addicting and I can drink a pitcher of it. can adjust the sweetness level on this drink. 

the couple who opened this place are the sweetest people. it is a hipster coffee place without the hipster attitude which is so rare in this city. Home is a blessing to San Francisco.
author: Jules L.

description: Home was delightful! Great location, coffee was amazing, amazing service, and cool/cozy vibe. Can't wait to go back. Their baked goods are realllly yummmy too!
author: Athena C.

description: Home ambiance, literally. Great place to sit and study. They have one of the cutest latte art I've seen and their delicious too! They serve some snacks as well to go with your coffee.
author: Rose T.

description: very cute little coffee shop with tons of places to sit, unfortuantely we were there during a busy time and had to sit in the windowsill.  The lattes were very tasty and cute.  It wasn't the best latte ever but it was definitely unique and worth stopping in
author: Geena G.

description: Visiting from Hawaii and this was a nice spot to stop by to get my coffee fix! Thank you for the wonderful hospitality
author: Nellezz L.

description: Wow wow wow! Possibly the best everything I've ever had! So yum! I ordered the let's avocuddle toast and the lavender latte and it was amazing. Will be coming back. It's really packed though so be warned! But line moves fast ;)
author: Diana T.

description: Absolutely delicious. Very creative lattes and very delicious. The lavender and rose lattes are a must try!
author: Monica L.

description: It was my first time here and the experience was better than I expected! The staff was very nice, the wait wasn't long at all and the coffee was cute and really good!
author: Angela M.

description: Definitely good coffee and toasts are sooo good, but just don't get the rainbow coffee. Their other drinks are so much better and I swear the rainbow ones are just sweet coffee flavored milk, they really are not worth the hype. It's a cute picture, but just get the salted caramel iced coffee or a regular mocha latte. Definitely try the toasts though! They are all to die for!
author: Arianna R.

description: We loved the warm vibe and the variety of creative drinks and lattes...very welcoming and friendly and the selection of toasts looked great.... the best part is the GREAT lattes we had... we ll be back tommorow morning
author: Pat D.

description: Cute coffee shop with toasts, but they need to get rid of the laptop crew! There were people sitting at all the tables immersed in their laptops with a cup of day old cold coffee to justify their existence at the table. Super annoying. I would have more to say, but I couldn't order anything other than a drink because there would be no place to sit and eat ... why? Because of the laptop crew claiming the tables! Down with the laptop crew!
author: Igor V.

description: Friendly service, delicious handcrafted espressos for a slightly higher than average price. Conveniently located off 19th Ave.
author: Adorable T.

description: Second location recently open. I actually enjoyed their HOME spot in sunset Noriega. The service is great but there were two flaws besides no fried eggs that I just can't give them 4 star compare to their Noriega location. First is their toast. It's just regular thin toast you can get at any store and make it at home yourself.  Their other location is a nice soft thick bread that u can add fried egg on any yummy toast. Yes the Noriega location doesn't have avocado toast like when they first open vs this new place. The second flaw was their internet. I'm very positive it wasn't our two diff version iPad and my iPhone that will not connect to the internet. When we told one of the workers, she tried it and said to restart it which we did and no results. She even said other people is connecting to it. Well cmon now, they might have their own wifi or maybe too many people on wifi . Their other location also isn't very good but at lease it does connect even though it's slow. I would suggest this place to get better bandwidth internet and same brioche soft yummy thick toast like their Noriega location plus fried eggs of course. I'll give this another try when they update those two flaw. Oh yeah, I do love their many flavor drinks.
author: Christy V.

description: Such a cute and homey environment! The staff was so nice. Loved the decor and the atmosphere. The avocado toast sampler was really good and a good portion in my opinion. They have really cool creative twists on their coffees and toasts. I've never had kimchi on my avocado toast till I came here and it was really good! Definitely worth a try!
author: Gianna C.

description: This is a must try if your around the area. Wifi is available if you need it, there are also tables with signs that say, "Enjoy each other's company" in which laptops are not allowed on. So many options for coffee birthday Cake and Rose Latte are delicious!
author: Ana A.

description: Cool menu, love the creativity and vibe. Though I think it's over priced. The bravo toast was good. And the lavender latte was just ok. Presentation is awesome - perfect for snapping pics. Overall this place is just too hyped up.
author: Justine J.

description: This place is the best! I had a delicious sea salt caramel latte that wasn't too sweet! I love the subtle taste of flavored lattes, but the majority of places make it way too sweet. I asked for this a bit less sweet and it was divine. The latte art is adorable of course! Avocado toast sampler was delish. Awesome inside space to work at or chat! I can't wait for their outdoor patio space to open!
author: Danielle M.

description: Came to visit from the east coast and Home lived up to its five star ratings.. I got the birthday cake rainbow vanilla latte. I'm usually not a coffee drinker but it was the right amount of sweetness to coffee. After carrying the heavily filled cup I managed to spill a bit but that didn't stop me from taking photos. In the corner of my eye As I'm enjoying my drink I see a staff member walking towards me with a cup of coffee and don't mind it. Turns out he saw me struggling and wanted to make sure I had the best experience while being here. IF THAT ISNT GREAT SERVICE I DONT KNOW WHAT IS. Very happy with me experience
author: Kieu W.

description:
This is my first review ever ... And I've definitely saved it for the best! The atmosphere at Home is extremely welcoming. The Richmond has needed a coffee cafe like this. I'm so glad Home is here. 

I got the cold brew on a misty morning and it is perfectly strong to start the day. I also ordered the Br-Avo (bacon avocado toast w/ radish). It was delicious! 

Owners In and Annie are a precious couple that are so warm to their customers it makes you want to come back! 

Also not to mention their music choices are always on point :)
author: Hilary L.

description:
This place is sooooo dope. Remember to take photos BEFORE drinking, as hard as it may be.

Visited this small coffee shop out in the Sunset District, and was stoked that I did. It is coffee, avocado toast, and light breakfast food with a colorful twist. Highly recommend the Birthday Cake Latte for both taste AND looks. I ordered a Red Velvet Latte, which was OK, but I my friend had the Birthday Cake Latte and it was fantastic. The barista/cashier was kind enough to explain the taste of each of the latte's we were considering to order before actually making our final decision. Great, great experience.
author: Jason D.

description:
Oh my sweet lord, this place is good. And I didn't know until reading other reviews that this is Home's second location, with the original being in the Sunset. Man oh man, am I glad to have stumbled upon it! 

First, it's so charming and welcoming, with service to match. you won't find any grouchy, hipster baristas here who are too cool to smile. Second, there are actually places to sit - plenty of them, including a large, open space in the back. Third, the menu is super tempting, with all kinds of unique varieties of coffee and tea drinks, as well as an entire column dedicated to toast. Toast? Yes, toast. The avo-cuddle was even more delightful to eat than it was to say, with a to-die-for meld of butter or some type of oil, avocado, arugula, cherry tomatoes and crushed red pepper. MMMMMMMMMMMM.

Home is a fabulous addition to this corridor. And please note, if you're wondering, that this place is not a replacement for the fabulous, nearby Angelina's. There is plenty of room for both kids on the block, as they serve two quite different purposes. Woo hoo! Thank you Richmond 'hood.
author: Kiesha R.

description: The avocado toast here was magical, I don't think I've ever tried something with so much flavor and yet so creamy at the same time. I also NEVER drink coffee but I couldn't turn down the opportunity of taking a sip of a latte with my favorite past time cereal (cookie crisps) lining the side of the mug. The cafe even suggests a computer free zone giving you the opportunity to enjoy one anothers company face to face (shocking I know!).
author: Erin H.

description: For a little, non-assuming cafe on Clement, Home is a place you'll never want to leave. Modern, friendly, and inviting Home makes a great space to work, read, or catch-up with a friend. The cappuccinos are consistently excellent and they offer fun improvements to average avo-toast. If you're over the avocado buzz (all good things come to an end) order the cereal toast. Don't overthink it; it's totally what you're really craving.
author: Megan M.

description: They were incredibly nice. They cleaned our table right away (other guests had just left). They did not make us feel like tourist! I can't stand when I'm traveling and the locals are rude just because we aren't locals! We had the bravo toast, happy birthday latte, a hot americano, and an almond croissant. They were all exceptional :) the croissant was nice and soft, they warmed it up, the bravo toast was so good I wanted another, but we had to leave. lol.
author: Sonya O.

description: This place was a gem! All of their drinks are so creative I had the red velvet latte and it wasn't just beautiful, it was delicious! Looking forward to trying other drinks! The shop itself is very aesthetically pleasing with marble tables and more of a minimalist theme. Will return for sure when in the area next!
author: Rebecca K.

description: I yelped this cute little gem before heading there & when we got there, the first thing we saw was a smiling face ready to take our order. She was very nice and described the birthday cake latte to me and let me know that it's the most Instagrammed drink at the cafe, so naturally, I went with that. She mentioned it doesn't taste like birthday cake but that they could certainly make it sweeter for me, in which they did, and I'm glad as it was delicious & beautiful. My husband got the salted caramel with a cute design on his latte too, and it was also delicious! The decor was cute and simple + there was lots of seating.
author: Angela P.

description: Great coffee option in the neighborhood. The coffee and service is good.
author: M. F.

description:
Ever felt something hug your very soul? Well, this coffee shop did just that!
I am a lady of simple tastes, 
1) quality of food
2) quality of service
3) cleanliness 

This place exceeded them all! As soon as I came in I saw how clean this place was and was immediately greeted with their friendly baristas. They were super kind and helpful, made you feel like you were family.

I got the lavender coffee (if you like floral flavors this coffee is for you) and loved it was not that sweet. My family all got their "flavored coffee" vanilla and coconut and they loved that it was not that sweet to them as well. 
This ended up being our favorite place to go while we were in SF.

Some tips:
Don't be afraid to try new flavors you really cannot go wrong.
The area they are located is really nice.
Parking was tricky, I am not use to SF style parking rules. I am use to "if there is a meter you can park there". So please read the metered parking rules on the street so you don't get ticketed! 

Other than that, this place is a must when I come back to SF. And there is a reason they are 5 stars!
author: Jay N.

description: Delicious coffee and the appearance of it tops it off. Employees are incredibly nice! Got the Birthday Cake latte.
author: Clarissa C.

description: Very pleased with their delicious Rose Latte (not yet on the menu as of this writing)! It's just the right amount of sweetness, not too sugary, with a fresh rose after taste and beautiful petals. Great job Home! I look forward to dropping by more often when I'm in this part of town!
author: Erin P.

description:
I saw this place all over instagram, and since its a block away from my boyfriends house I knew I needed to try it out. Walked in, and was immediately helped by the women who I would assume is the owner. She explained in detail every drink, as well as what they are known for. The back of the coffee shop isn't fully done I would assume, but it will be an amazing place to sit, enjoy a rainbow vanilla latte, and do some homework. 

My brother had the Rose Latte, his girlfriend had a coconut latte of some sorts, and I had the rainbow vanilla latte. I WILL be back.
author: Brooke B.

description:
After enjoying the ambiance and food at their Noriega location, I was excited to visit this one. Needless to say, they successfully captured the exact same atmosphere, with a few additional drinks, and a completely new food menu.

I went with the standard chai tea latte with cinnamon, and the "Soul Much Avo" (toast with avocado, spicy kimchi, and pine nuts); both of which I highly recommend. 

As expected, metered parking is decently easy to find. All day parking exists, but would take a miracle to find (like the rest of the outer sunset). Still, Home is a very quaint place to study all day, or just relax with a drink and some toast. The staff here goes above and beyond, and essentially creates the atmosphere of "Home".
author: Dominic E.

description: Came here on a Tuesday around noon and there were still seats! Got some studying done :) Great atmosphere and friendly staff. I ordered the Lavender Latte and it was so gooooood!
author: Bonnie Y.

description: I saw this place when passing by to drop off my son to school and needed a cup of coffee. I walked in and was immediately impressed with the look and welcoming feel. They just opened yesterday and have a creative twist on you "normal" coffee shop. They have outdoor area, but not open yet. I had the toast with honey, bananas, strawberries and peanut butter and latte.
author: Satish P.

description:
Grand opening and the the line was not as bad as I thought it would be. We got our coffee drinks, Cookie Monster & Birthday Came, relatively quick after ordering however we did have to wait about 10 mins longer for our Seoul Much Avo Toast. Still worth it!

The toast was tasty and the coffees were very cute. 

Home is a lovely addition to the neighborhood and will definitely be back to try the lavender latte soon.
author: Lauren B.

description: After visiting the Home in the Sunset several times, I was so excited when Home came to the Richmond. The owners are super sweet and you can find them at the shop working their tails off almost every day. The coffee is never acidic and the drinks are served at the perfect drinkable temperature. This is my go to place and every time I deviate and go to another coffee shop I wish I just would've went to home!
author: Amber B.

description: Such an instagram worthy place from the menu board to the "marble" tables. I had the coconut vanilla latte with almond milk and it was one of the best lattes I've had. The latte was creamy, frothy, and flavorful. The lattes are also asthetically pleasing and are little beautiful works of art in a cup.
author: Raebern B.

description: Favorite neighborhood coffee shop. They have an assortment of unique specialty drinks but my favorite is the refreshing "hangover", which is iced Pellegrino and two espresso shots. It's better to come here on a weekday as there are long lines on the weekend.
author: Talia M.

description: The quality of food and coffee is great, employees were very nice and friendly. Great ambiance to work / or simply hangout. Oh, and shout out to the employee who let me borrow their phone charger! ;) appreciate it.
author: Catherine T.

description: Couldn't decide on which creative latte to try. Took a suggestion and it was on point
author: Luis M.

description:
The owner and staff are all extremely nice. This place is well decorated, clean, and comfortable. 

Did I mention 30 mbps internet?

Yup.
author: Tim H.

description: Listen - I'm not much of a coffee drinker but this place is AMAZING. Their pastries are fantastic and I highly recommend the beautiful birthday cake latte. This is the most cute, aesthetic, good for taking photos coffee shop ever. I love it!
author: Alex J.

description: The atmosphere and vibe at Home is incomparable; balancing sleek and hip with homey and comfortable. The staff is all very friendly and remain calm and kind even during rush times. It does get busy quickly so be prepared to either wait or go early. The coffee is gorgeous, but not the tastiest in the area. The toast, however, is absolutely delicious. All around Home is a unique experience, even in the hip and ever changing area.
author: Carla C.

description: More like 3.5 stars. The coffee is pretty good and the creative coffee offerings are fun. However, it is hard to find seating and the baristas aren't particularly friendly, so I definitely wouldn't make the trek out here again... it is a kind of over-hyped, one time stop.
author: Sadie G.

description: Spacious, super friendly and knowledgeable staff, and delicious drinks....the most important part!
author: Tommy H.

description:
If you're looking for a place with a calm atmosphere and a good selection of drinks, this is the place.

The staff is amazing along with the layout/design of the place, the sign they place in front stating "Welcome Home" doesn't lie. 

Just a few notes:

-Coffee here is good with a good selection, very well brewed and smooth.
-Parking is street only but not too much an issue on weekdays, lots of meters.
-Staff is amazing and welcoming
-The toast is very tasty and on the light fair side. 

Highly recommend if you're looking for a positive atmosphere place in the morning to chill out or a quick afternoon pick me up break from life.
author: Brian H.

description: One of my favorite coffee shops. Very San Francisco like. I love modern set up and their coffee is fantastic. Menu has unique options, I enjoyed everything we have tried so far... Now they have location close to my place, very exciting!
author: S. G.

description: Many people come here for the unicorn style lattes but I have to say, my favorite drink is their "Hangover" - espresso & sparkling water.  I came here with my mom and we waited a long time for our avocado toast (too long) and finally went up to ask what the deal was.  After consulting the staff, they realized that another table had taken our order instead and were extremely apologetic.  I was pleasantly surprised that when they had brought out our food they gave us a banana muffin and cookie selection on the house for our inconvenience.  Amazing customer service and great spot in the Outer Richmond! Will be a new go to weekend place.
author: Shelby N.

description:
What's not to love about specialty coffee and avocado toast? I've tried the birthday cake, Cookie Monster, and Nutella lattes, all of which were both beautiful and tasty! They are very sweet, which is to be expected with names like that. Home also has great pour over coffee for those who are looking for a food plain cup of coffee. 

The avo toast is unique and intriguing. The flavors are fun and delish! I thoroughly enjoyed the kimchi toast. 

I'm so excited to have this spot nearby! It seems to be avoiding the crowds of the sunset location.
author: Sarah S.

description: If you want "likes" on Instagram this is the perfect place! I ordered the cookie butter latte (it was room temperature & didn't taste remotely like cookie butter) & Chicken meatball pesto toast (it was OK could've used more pesto). My friend ordered the Cook-Monster Gato & it was so creamy & delicious.
author: Naz M.

description: The second Home location here in SF. This spot keeps its aesthetically pleasing vibe and long delicious list of lattes. However, it has a different toast selection than that from the Noriega location. This spot uses a rustic sourdough slice, instead of a large texas toast. Some of my favorites from the toast menu are the ABB's of toast and the Avocado toast. Another go to coffee shop for me!
author: Tina A.

description: Rainbow latte is cute, sorta too hyped up. Their toasts are very light on the atomach but taste good. Any of the ones with avocado, must try.
author: Albert N.

description: This cafe has amazing, creative coffees and super good food!! The only thing I would complain about is the lack of seating, since it is such a beautiful environment and it killed me to have to take my order to go. Their lattes are definitely worth the hype, and I would specifically recommend their birthday cake one. The staff was super nice and accommodating, and I would definitely come again.
author: Danika L.

description: I live a few blocks away from here and visit a lot. The staff usually recognize me and know my name/order. It's so nice to finally have a good coffee shop in the Richmond for catching up with friends and/or studying!! The mango coconut croissants are the BEST!! The chai latte is incredible as well. I usually switch it up between chai latte, sea salt caramel latte, or the rose latte (which comes with actual rose petals!!) Yes it's a little pricey, but the quality and service is so worth it.
author: Emma A.

description: Cool hangout and really good coffee! Tried a couple different kinds but the Cookie Monster took the cake in my opinion.
author: Jonathan F.

description: I love the name, the vibe, the drinks, and the service! you can change the sweetest which helps a lot.
author: Connie X.

description:
LOVE LOVE LOVE! Their coffee here is perfect! Not to sweet, not to bitter. The workers are very welcoming, they put on a smile when you walk in and they make sure you are satisfied with your drink. 

Got the coconut vanilla latte(so far my favorite). Doesn't have much of a coconut taste. My friends also got the rose latte and the birthday cake latte. The rose latte is different. It has a peculiar taste in which you either love it or hate it. I usually like rose drinks but maybe not mixed with coffee. The birthday cake is also great as well. If you don't like it that sweet, ask for less sweetness. 

The designs are very aesthetic too. Great for photos :)
author: Janet C.

description: The only word to describe their latte is 'divine'!  I drive 20 blocks for it; their noshes are yummy and reasonably priced.
author: Milena M.

description: Everyone who works here is super nice.  The drinks are works of art and very tasty.  The ambience is delightful and I really appreciated the girl offering me an option not on the menu.  I was going for the lavender late and she suggested the rose.  It was phenomenal, I have never before experienced a late of such caliber.  It was a full on coffee sensory experience.  I take everyone who visits me here.  Definitely a must if your in the Richmond!
author: Colzie T.

description: The pour over coffee is as much a fantastic start to the morning as the people who work here are- so welcoming, and with a menu like this I'll have to come back. They also had R&B music playing lightly in the background. We're talking that good R&B. Get some.
author: Jeff G.

description: This place is amazing. Well worth the drive! I initially went to the sunset location, but decided to come to the other one because I really wanted to try the avocado toast sampler. The sampler was delicious, and at $9 not too expensive (considering it's not just avocado). The matcha toast was sweet but not overwhelming. My brother got the cereal toast which he seemed to enjoy. The lavender latte was great, not too sweet but with a distinct lavender flavor. I also tried my brothers bday cake latte, and as with the lavender latte it wasn't overwhelmingly sweet. Would definitely come here again.
author: Olga T.

description: Love this place, the drinks, the aesthetic and the free WiFi. Only reason I gave it a 4 is because it's a bit pricy
author: Pnut B.

description: The coffee here is rather average, despite all the rave about the latte art. For me, what really sets this place apart from other cafes is the ambiance and the accessibility to study from where I live. It's a great place for me to stop by and be productive away from home! So if you live close by, I definitely recommend grabbing a cup of coffee while you get some work done here!
author: Mary Y.

description: Fantastic spot lattes were great and the avacodo French toast looked bomb, it was huge. I didn't get it unfortunately, but I did have a bit of my boyfriends chocolate croissant (which is way better if you ask for it toasted ) super flaky and a great treat with the latte, which don't take that long to come out either I swear I've waited longer at Starbucks for a plain Americano than I did for an artistic latte that I got here reason I'm giving a star less is because the seating is so bad too many people on laptops and not enough space for everyone they should reduce the time they can stay when it's busy or get some more seats in the back
author: Michelle M.

description: Home is my happy place! I usually don't write reviews, but their Richmond location is such a gem, I felt compelled to leave one. The owners and employees are absolute sweethearts, and I've had nothing but good experiences here. My go-to is the rose tea latte (off menu) with a croissant. Ample seating, open layout, and relaxed atmosphere. Other creative and fun menu items if coffee is your thing! You won't be disappointed :)
author: Robyn B.

description: The coffee is great, the folks that work here are the best and super friendly and bright little coffee shop in the hood. Go there!
author: Julie K.

description: I was driving to Golden Gate Park when my best friend and I decided to stop for coffee, so I came across Home on Yelp. We were first greeted by Christine who had AMAZING customer. She made good recommendations and was very genuine! Aside from the exceptional workers, the food itself was very good! (I recommend the tomato pesto toast). I also tried a lightly sweet hazelnut latte which was so perfectly made! I will definitely be back when I'm in the area
author: Christina S.

description: I was so mesmerized by this place! I loved that they do these really unique lattes and I thought they were so good! Birthday cake latte does not taste like birthday cake it taste like hazelnut actually so it's definitely not anything weird or gross like the unicorn Frapuccino at Starbucks LOL! It's definitely just for looks but the coffee is really good. I also love that they had signs on all the tables that say please spend time with each other instead of being on your computers. I thought that was so unique and special! However I was just appointed that almost half the people in there we're on laptops even when they were with other people. But great place definitely a good place to check out if you're in San Francisco.
author: Kendra B.

description: Such cute latte art and toast here is so simple but tasty!! The birthday cake latte does not taste like a birthday cake, but the latte was quintessential. This place has such a chill atmosphere, most tables were filled with people on their laptops or groups hanging out. Large space, nice aesthetics, and best of all...friendly staff! Great vibes all around.
author: Joshua M.

description: The vibe of this place is just wonderful and you can't go wrong with your drink choice.  The rose latte is light and delicious, the hazelnut latte yum yum, and the chai latte is reminiscent of rice pudding.
author: Alissa C.

description: My favorite place to grab coffee in my neighborhood. Staff is really friendly and welcoming. The shop itself is really big. Lots of places to sit. And the lates are AMAZING!
author: Alfredo R.

description: Really cute small cafe but beware.....some seatings are not allowed to have laptops. Drinks are visually pretty and they can make kids drinks with no caffeine in them so they can also join in on the colorful designs. I got the birthday cake latte and it not only looked good, but tasted amazing!
author: Semhar G.

description: I LOVE IT!!! The workers are super friendly and they keep their cafe looking super cute and it is definitely an environment I would want to be in. The lighting is perfect because they use natural light by having a big window, they have cute light bulbs for decoration. The drinks themselves aren't just super delicious but they make its very cute and unique. If ur name isn't too long they can possibly spell ur name out on ur drink. definitely a place to go because of  free wifi and spacing, also charging outlets!
author: Veronica L.

description: A great place with a bunch going for it.  Service tends to slow down quickly with even a small line.  Tasty things to snack on, and friendly people.
author: Luke B.

description: Best latte of my entire life, no exaggeration. I live in Los Angeles, but I will definitely be back the next time I visit SF!
author: Gabriela H.

description: I got the birthday cake latte and it did kind of taste like it.  I think the red velvet one is more flavorful than this.  I'm still giving it 5 stars since the food was pretty awesome and it's cool to see the coffee designs.
author: Rebecca V.

description: Walked in before close and wouldn't serve. Sign still out, door open, people still inside. Pretty sad for a brand new place.
author: Nathan L.

description: Birthday cake latte is good, doesn't taste like birthday cake but it's a vanilla latte with a little hazelnut. Also I tried the Thai iced tea cake which was really gooood. Staff is friendly and kind. I want to come back and try all their awesome lattes.
author: Mina S.

description: Small, quaint cafe that I stopped by after a hike.  The Milk and Cereal Toast was perfectly crisp toast with Lucky Charms on top, fresh strawberries and a drizzle of condense milk.  Seriously the best invention ever!!! Paired with their Birthday Cake Latte (Aka hazel nut with a beautiful rainbow design on top) it was a great combo!
author: Run.It.Off V.

description:
I've been to the Noriega location many times and it's been great every time. The matcha latte is my favorite. I've also had the popular birthday latte. Visually it looked amazing and it tasted really good, not too sweet. 
My friend usually gets the Americano, he's pretty particular about his coffee, and he says this is one of his favorite places. Also, the staff is super friendly! Thanks Home, we'll be back.
author: Tanya D.

description: Came here with some girls to catch up on life and was immediately greeted by the workers and I think the owner. Since they noticed I had some difficulty choosing a drink, they asked me what I usually drank and offered some of their drinks based off of what I said. When I mentioned that I preferred my drinks less sweet, I was told that sweetness could be adjusted easily. Drinks were tasty and the latte art was beautiful. Although the drinks are on the pricier side, the customer service and quality of the drinks make it worth it! Space was quite roomy and I love how they designate some tables to be laptop free so we can enjoy each other's presence and talk face to face.
author: Julie L.

description: This place in the Richmond actually feels like a home. The mocha has a nice visual effect and isn't too sweet. It's a little pricey though. Overall a good hangout
author: Wilson W.

description:
If I could give this place 10 STARS, I would! I came in for the first time the morning after my aunt passed away. She was all about her favorite neighborhood cafes so it seemed fitting to finally try this place. I hadn't eaten in almost 24 hours and barely slept. I broke down in tears mid order and the staff could not have been sweeter and more patient with me. When I pulled out my wallet to pay, James refused to let me and told me everything was on the house. I even told him that I didn't have any cash to tip cuz I was planning to pay with a card and he told me not worry about it and that it was the least he could do after everything I'd been through and to just sit down and they would take good care of me. I was sooo touched. They didn't have to do that for me. Not only was everything amazing and delicious, I truly felt like I was being taken care of as if I was home with family. Their sign out front reads: 

"Welcome home!! coffee, tea, toasts and love" 

They definitely have the love part down. They provided a much needed bright and shining warm break in an otherwise dark and terrible cold time for me and I will be coming back every chance I get! So grateful to have picked this place that morning. My only complaint is that they are only open til 5pm! If they were open later I would come EVERYDAY after work!
author: Catherine P.

description: Place is so cute and no laptops allowed. Even though I did see 3 people with theirs out.  Anyways. I ordered the new Rose Latte with the Milk and cereal toast.  The rose latte was surprisingly very tasty with the classic latte taste mixed in with hints of rose.  The presentation is beautiful, I'll upload pics later.  The milk and cereal toast was very sweet but fun.  I probably won't order it again, because it was just too sweet for me.  I want to try their avocado toast. Worth the trip and worth the money.  A little pricey but considering the presentation and quality of what you are getting, it is well worth the money.  Service was awesome and friendly.  Will be coming back again.
author: Victoria C.

description: Home Cafe is the perfect place to work or catch up with friends. Never too loud, never too dead. Their lattes and deliciously addicting and the toasts are tasty as well. Wifi is always fast, which is a huge plus! The staff are the friendliest, I highly recommend this place!
author: Daniel N.

description: I've been wanting to try Home since it opened on Noriega, but never found the time to since it was far. I'm glad they opened one in the Richmond and it was time to try it! It's very aesthetic inside and the drinks are as well. I'm very indecisive and the workers offered to recommend things and were very kind. My friend and I got the affogato, organic matcha latte, matcha love toast, and the abbs toast. The affogato was alright and it wasn't that strong. The matcha latte took a while to make but it was really cute! There was latte art on it of a peacock and I immediately understood why it took awhile. The art was so amazing and it tasted great! Not too sweet, but not too bitter! The cashier asks questions to make the drink accustomed to you by asking for the sweetness and what sugars you would like. I thought that was very nice of them and I got regular sweetness. It is more on the herbal side but I really enjoyed it. The matcha love toast was super good! The strawberries were sweet and he matcha flavor was great! I definitely would get it again. The abbs toast was pretty filling because of the almond butter and it was good as well. The workers were kind to ask if cinnamon was okay on it. I love how kind the workers are and the aesthetics!! I would come again to try one of the avocado toasts and another latte.
author: Lauren L.

description: Best new coffee shop in the Richmond! This place is beautiful and welcoming with an incredibly friendly staff (Annie the owner is so sweet!). But it doesn't end there--they serve up delicious Four Barrel Coffee! I had a little lavender cappuccino with perfect milk texture. Yum!  Oh and they also have awesome pastries, I highly recommend the bacon spring onion roll thing I noshed on! I really can't say enough wonderful things about this spot. I am so excited to have this great place in the hood.
author: Katherine M.

description:
1) friendly staff
2) great food
3) even better looking lattes 

Would love to revisit soon!
author: Alex P.

description: I came to this place every day of my SF stay. The owners are always really welcoming ("welcome home!") and the space they're in is nice and contemporary. I got the rainbow latte because well, you have to! It's great and not so sugary sweet like it may seem. I also got the 3 toast sampler and it is so. dang. good. Unique spin on avocado toast.
author: Sarah J.

description: Aesthically pleasing to be in. Cute lattees , love the atmosphere . Needs more seating tho
author: Sabrina V.

description: Went in there bright and early and there wasn't a wait at all. Seeing as it was my first time there, they kindly explained the menu and suggested things to fit what I like. The lattes were good, but they really did go above and beyond to make me feel like I was Home, even remembering my name when they called out goodbye as I left. If I'm ever back in town I'll definitely drop by again!
author: Y B.

description:
I am really sorry to offend the owners of this cafe because it does look very nice. The furniture is nice, the interior is nice, everything is new, internet works. But you guys did many things in a half assed way and did not think everything through.
-the way you guys arranged seats is not good. You have a small table and everyone back to the wall facing the counter. All those seats on the other side of the table are wasted. You should add a second row of tables to maximize space
Example: I was at your cafe and there were two women with babies in strollers. They waited and waited by the window for some time and no seats freed up. They had to leave and eat their sandwich outside standing up. You see something like that please help accommodate them. Keep some extra chairs and offer them to people when you are full since you seem to be filled up.
-almost everybody takes up a seat and sits there for hours with their computer. Older people or random people want to stop and sit for a few minutes. That's why you should also keep extra chairs that you can offer people. It does not cost anything but helps everyone.
-the coffee is much more expensive than any mainstream coffee chain yet it doesn't actually taste better or anything. Small cup for $2.75? I understand things are expensive but at least make this coffee taste different or make it much stronger. Maybe brew fresher coffee and put more grounds in?
-the room looks great but since you guys have hard floor and hard walls. When you have at least half of the room filled up the noise becomes very loud and resonates. You should add padding to walls or put paintings and plants up so they absorb the sound. It is extremely difficult to read or study when the sound is so loud.

Sorry to say the above complaints. I just want to help.
author: Monkey C.

description: I came here on Tuesday with some of my friends and I must say that this is probably one of my favorite coffee shops in San Francisco. The decor inside is aesthetically pleasing, along with the choices and variety of coffee/drinks they offer. The staff are very friendly as well, and make sure that your visit to their shop is welcoming :) we came here with dogs so we had to get our drinks to go, but we will sure return next time without them to enjoy our coffee inside the shop!
author: Lauren O.

description: I love this spot! I'm actually not a coffee drinker, but they have such a wider variety of drinks, pastries, and toast... there really is something here for everyone. The atmosphere is extremely inviting and bigger than the location in the Sunset, so it's always nice to meet up with a friend and catch up. Lastly, the staff are incredibly nice! Wouldn't change a thing about this place.
author: Sinead G.

description: Tasty, slightly overpriced coffee and small, overpriced small plates/toasts. This place is all about the pomp and circumstance. Looks great on Instagram. Will you leave hungry? Yes.
author: Diana B.

description: Clean and inviting space with an extremely friendly staff makes this a much-needed addition to the Outer Richmond cafe scene. Compared to some other nearby coffee places that I won't name, Home offers a creative menu for both drinks and breakfast/lunch options and their execution demonstrates that they actually care about quality and presentation. Their location is not on the busiest street so I hope they can be successful as the food and service are top-notch.
author: Adam B.

description: Very nice place! Finally a place with great seating and Amazing coffee! My office is right down the street so it's nice to come to a new coffee shop with great selection of coffee! I can't wait to have their afogatos when it gets warmer! Will def be back!
author: Jessica A.

description: This place is my go-to local coffee shop whenever I feel like chilling and getting my work done! The staff excels at hospitality and their latte art is very impressive. Red velvet latte and avo-cuddle + say cheese are my favorite-- none of the three is too sweet; they all taste like as they should be. Emits a very calm and welcoming ambiance with plenty of 2-person beautiful tables. Bring your significant other, laptop, books, pets, or anything you enjoy spending time with for a very pleasant coffee time
author: Honest R.

description: It's great having a cafe in this neighborhood that is trendy and not Starbucks. They offer unique lattes  (matcha!) And a great atmosphere. Perfect Saturday morning.
author: Ashley F.

description: Cozy with friendly folks dishing out tasty drinks and savory toasts. Nice place to study or work, thanks for the wifi. A welcome addition to the Richmond.
author: Brady K.

description: Omg...dont get on this hype train. Got a coconut vanilla latte. It just tasted like sweetened coffee, nothing special. I definatly did not taste any hints of coconut or vanilla. They made a cute bear out of foam so that was nice but not worth it. A $5 small latte..too much. The inside was decorated well and was clean. Felt like everyone was getting lattes just to instagram them not because they tasted good. Definitely skip this place
author: Emm J.

description: What a lovely cafe! Very cute and great tea...i got a london fog which was delicious. Also like the fact that some tables are reserved for non laptop use so it doesn't become a office! Great service too.
author: Danielle C.

description: If you love Home's food and drinks from their Outer Sunset location, you need to stop by their new one. There are lots of tables and space; there's a large one for a big group in the back and they're working on doing something with the back patio. They have a Cookie Monster-gato, a cookie butter affogato that's topped with Cookie Crisps, mmmm. The cereal toast is a fun toast that brings back childhood memories, plus it's colorful (Lucky Charms!). As always, I ordered their cookie butter latte.
author: Katherine S.

description: Everything was great. There celebrating their 3 year anniversary and all creative drinks are $3. The make cool designs on there lattes. The wife really enjoyed it.
author: Edward M.

description: Overpriced toast and non-functional wifi.  I was willing to pay for pricy coffee and toast w hopes of getting work done but didn't even get wifi out of my visit.  :(
author: Tina H.

description: Great coffee and great customer service and worker. New location, great workers - everyone was super welcoming and kind. Got an Americano, good espresso and plenty of tables/seating. It looks like they also have more room to put more tables in and such. Got power outlets under the main lobby bench which is good to come here and do some studying. This is a great new spot. Check it out!
author: Theo L.
