description: Lavendar latte is da bomb. Their coffee art game is always on point too. Computer friendly place to work.
author: Hamrez S.

description: A nice minimal atmosphere to sit in read or get some work done. They have a huge toast menu and a very experimental drink menu.
author: Harlow M.

description: cutest lattes EVER!! came here for the birthday latte (on my birthday eve!) and also got the rose latte (i think it's new/seasonal). so good, so cute. and the service was wonderful! they're so nice and they actually recommended the rose latte which i fell in love with. there's so many fun drinks on the menu i want to try them all when i'm back in town! parking is also easy. and it's close to the 16th ave tiled steps!
author: Lisa W.

description: Yum! The coffee is so good. I love the lavender latte. I was hanging in the Avenues when I popped into this cute cafe, and I'm so glad I did! The space is open & modern, the people are friendly and the vibe really contributes to the sense of community in the Richmond.
author: Anna Y.

description: The people that work here are very nice friendly and helpful the place itself it's clean and good seating .the latte's are good . But it's a little over priced and I did have something to eat there, it was OK, it's toast with different ingredients on it and again a little over priced. Overall their lattes and coffees and teas are good, but the food I am not impressed.
author: Pat C.

description: What a great addition to the neighborhood!  Wonderful space, bright, clean and fresh.  The lattes are delicious and the staff is wonderful!
author: Alexandra J.

description: I come here pretty often with my girlfriend for coffee before school. My go to drink is the London Fog while hers is the Lavender Latte (Iced). Drinks here are pretty unique and creative, not too bland but not too sweet or bitter. Service here is friendly, definitely worth 5 stars all around.
author: Ken H.

description: I love this place. I loved their Sunset location, but it got too crowded and I was never able to find a seat. This location is more spacious and open. There are enough outlets if you need to camp out. The service is top notch as always, and their lavender jasmine tea latte is delicious! Parking is metered, but there are plenty available on a weekday (I don't know about weekends).
author: Jennie V.

description: Awesome selection, but the place really need a second espresso machine - lines out the door and waiting 25 (!) minutes for a latte. While the coffee was good it was not worth the wait.
author: Sarah S.

description: LOVE HOME!! Felt just like home. So welcomed by such warming staff. Great lattes...my favorite was the rose latte...mmm..yummm...Hope to visit Home @ SF again!!
author: Susan L.

description: So cute and trendy with delicious toast options! Pleasantly surprised with how good the food was and definitely left full and satisfied.
author: Justine S.

description: I haven't been back in a while, but I finally had to peek in when I saw the huge crowds outside. This place certainly lives up to its hype and more. The staff is so attentive and friendly. Plenty of options for beautiful Instagram art from their assortment of lattes. Love having this new addition to the Richmond neighborhood. I'll definitely be back!
author: Sherry C.

description: The owners here are genuinely friendly. Good coffee and vibes! So glad you opened in this area. Creative lattes and toasts that are instagram worthy, as I'm  watching the customers click away.
author: MC C.

description: The staff is super friendly, the avocado toast is to die for and the lavender latte is legit! Welcome to the hood!
author: Sarah H.

description: Truly the best coffee shop I've ever been in. The owners are amazing, staff is amazing, great coffee and food! Absolutely perfect down to the last detail.
author: Autumn V.

description: My son and I stopped there yesterday. Wonderful service and super friendly baristas! Great coffee! Most creative (kid's) hot chocolate with marshmallow presentation! Absolutely loved the overall experience!!
author: Hemkiran G.

description: Honestly, the best freakin place in the world. If you ain't at Home cafe, you ain't turning up like us. So come thru. 10/5 stars
author: David P.

description: I was skeptical but am convinced. This place is great. Beautiful and clean space, yummy Lavendar latte, and really nice service at the cashier. I'm glad to have found this spot.
author: elaine l.

description: Dope trendy coffee here! I loved the art they make out of it! I got a quick late and it was so tasty and refreshing! The atmosphere is so good! Makes me have a great day!
author: Bryan K.

description: Is there anywhere as cute as this cafe??? If there is I would love to find out. I've looked in NY, SF, Tokyo, other major cities - Home is the best bar none (even beats out Daikanyama Tsutaya for me in Tokyo, bc of the menu). I just wish this weren't so far from the city center but I've taken 40-minute Ubers to get here before and work for a few hours, and it was well worth it. Faves are the birthday cake latte, lavender latte, London Fog - with a million other intriguing menu items to still try. If I ever move to SF I would seriously consider living in this area FOR Home Cafe (OK, and the delicious Vietnamese/Chinese food in the area). I'm currently sitting in a cafe that is not Home and regretting this choice. There's really nowhere like Home.
author: Cookie M.

description: a place for a cup of coffee, a tasty bakery delight in a well appointed space, bright airy with room for everyone, while conversing with long lost friends, alone working on the next project or a "mommy break" ... the staff warm inviting and professional ... uncle tim
author: tim y.

description: This is Such A good place the Hot Chocalate Here is Wonderful and Has A special Design on it, and Avacado Toast is Amazing.You Must Come here, The Service is the best
author: Giuseppe C.

description: Thank you for bringing good coffee to the neighborhood. Also, really nice people/service to boot! Thumbs up!
author: Gingersnappy T.

description: I have never felt more like an instagram model. The marble tables, contrasting wooden accents, light interior and tiny tabletop plants... and of course, the "Welcome Home" when you enter :')
author: Sona A.

description: My favorite latte place in sf to date! Rose and lavender soy lattes are the best. Birthday cake is pretty but so so sweet. Decor is adorable and staff is so friendly! 10/10
author: Sharon D.

description: Since moving to San Francisco, I was really looking forward to finding an awesome go to coffee spot. I came across Home cafe and saw their awesome reviews and beautiful drinks. I couldn't wait to try it! I was just in yesterday and decided to order the birthday cake latte as well as the let's avo-cuddle toast. The latte was beautifully made and was delicious! The avocado toast however, could barely pass as avocado toast, it had little to no avocado and was just topped with a ton of arugula to hide the fact. I was very disappointed in the toast. The drinks however are amazing!
author: Karen E.

description: This place is great. The lattes are bomb but what is even better is the SUPER kind workers. The cashier, and a different employee (and the woman who I interacted with the first time I came there) were all so genuine and friendly. Today was my second visit to the clement location and I will come back for another delicious vanilla coconut latte.
author: Brooke F.

description: I love this place.  The lattes are awesome, and the service is super friendly.  Lots of folks come here to work on their laptops, and people are generally friendly so you can share tables with them when it gets crowded.  The toast is also really tasty -- helps keep you going during those long work sessions.  No bike parking out front, but I'm going to ask about having a rack installed.
author: Cy C.

description: First day in SF- saw reviews and photos and had to see for myself. Got a lavender latte and it blew my mind. Espresso was awesome, too.
author: Molly L.

description: Came here today with my boyfriend after having walked around to find something chill and clean and good. This place is a gem, got myself the lavender latte with soy, such kind service, not snobby just so nice and chill.  lots of places to sit with every seat taken and lively:) happy customers working on computers nice calm music and families,  really great space larger than most around this neighborhood ,  with great food and coffee and service. We'll be back for sure definitely a new favorite day date spot to grab small bite and coffee.
author: Katie B.

description: I have wanted to come here for a quiet awhile now after seeing the exquisite pics on Instagram and snap. I finally had the time  to grab coffee with a few friends and I'm so glad we chose Home. Everything about it was aesthetically pleasing and everything we chose was just as good as it looked if not more delicious, which says a lot because everything does in fact look amazing. If your coming with a group of people I suggest trying to get there early to snag the left corner booth because it's a great place to take pics. I can't wait to come here again and I hope that they keep creating unique lattes to add to the list.However, I can say if you want aesthetics you should go for the birthday cake or the red velvet(it's red with a white swan) but as far as taste goes they are all delicious(my fav rn tho is the choco mint). Lastly, I have to point out that the staff is super kind so as of now, I have literally no complaints and I can only highly suggest you try this place out.
author: Grace D.

description: Super cute place with good coffee. The people behind the counter were so warm and friendly - they really did make you feel at home!
author: Dana O.

description: Four of us showed up on our way to Sausalito.  Stopped in for a coffee - and expected greatness because of the reviews here on yelp!  We got it!  Everyone loved their coffees.  Some were pour overs.  Mine was the "Birthday Cake" - and even though it was too pretty to drink - I slurped it down.  DELISH! We also ordered the Avocado Toast Sampler and the presentation was beautiful and all three slices were yum!  The owner (?) came by our table to check in - and told us that the interesting veggie on one of our avocado toasts was a slice of watermelon radish. (very hard to find!)  She stayed and chatted with us for awhile - and also told us that the expansion in the back is for their plan to be roasting their own coffee in the future.  She was filled with information and so passionate about her business (which she runs with her fiance).  We begged her to open in the south bay!  But for now - there are two locations and they are both right off 19th Ave - so go to this place next time you are driving north through the city.  You will leave happy!!!
author: Lizza M.
